src: Ziurtatu zure eskua ahalik eta lasaien dagoela nota guztiak zuzen jotzen dituzun bitartean; halaber, saiatu hatzekin beharrezkoak ez diren mugimendurik ez egiten. Hala, ahalik eta gutxien nekatuko zara. Gogoan izan ez dagoela teklak indar handiz sakatu beharrik bolumen gehigarria lortzeko, pianoarekin gertatzen denez. Akordeoiaren kasuan, bolumen gehigarria lortzeko, hauspoak presio edo abiadura handiagoarekin erabili behar dituzu.
mt: 1. Please keep your hands on the keyboard at all times unless you need to use the mouse. That way, you'll be less likely to make mistakes. 2. Don't hit the keys too hard in order to get more volume, as this can cause mistakes, as in the case of the piano. 3. To get more volume on the accordion, you need to press the bellows harder or faster.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Film bat DVD formatura bihurtzeko orduan, arazo ohikoenetako bat izaten da overscan. Telebista gehienak publiko orokorraren gustuen arabera egiten dira. Horregatik, ertzak ebaki zaizkio telebistan ikusten duzun guztiari (goian, behean, zein alboetan). Helburua da irudiak pantaila osoa betetzea; horri overscan esaten zaio. Zoritxarrez, DVD bat egitean, ertzak ere ebakiko dira ziur asko; eta, bideoak azpitituluak behealdetik hurbilegi baditu, ez dira osorik ikusiko.
mt: When converting a video to DVD, one of the most common problems is overscan. Most TVs are made to the average person's tastes. So, the edges are cut off of what you see on the screen (top, bottom, and sides). The goal is to fill the entire screen; this is called overscan. Unfortunately, when making a DVD, the edges will also be cut off; and if the video has subtitles at the bottom, they will not be fully visible.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Estatubatuarren planaren oinarria eraso koordinatuak egitean zetzan, hiru norabidetan. John Cadwalder jeneralak despistatzeko erasoa joko zuen Bordentownen garnizio britainarraren aurka, errefortzuak blokeatzeko helburuarekin. James Ewing jeneralak 700 milizia hartuko zituen ibaiaren bestaldean, Trenton Ferryn, Assunpik Creek gaineko zubia menderatu eta arerioen armadei ihes egitea eragotzi. 2.400 gizonek osatutako erasorako indar nagusiak Trentonetik bederatzi milia iparralderago gurutzatu zuen ibaia, eta bi taldetan banatu zen, bat Greeneren agindupean eta bestea Sullivanen agindupean, egunsentia baino lehen erasotzeko.
mt: The plan called for coordinated attacks in three directions. General John Cadwalder would attack the British garrison at Bordentown, with the aim of blocking reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river, at Trenton Ferry, to capture the bridge over Assunpink Creek and prevent the enemy from escaping. The main force of 2,400 men crossed the river nine miles north of Trenton, and divided into two columns, one under General Greene and the other under General Sullivan, to attack before sunset.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Kongresuan uztailaren 4an onartu ondoren, eskuz idatzitako eta John Hancock Kongresuko presidenteak eta Charles Thomson idazkariak sinatutako zirriborro bat bidali zen handik hurbil zegoen John Dunlapen inprimategira. “Dunlapen paperak” bezala ezagutzen direnak 150 eta 200 kopia artean egin ziren gau hartan. Dokumentuaren lehenengo irakurketa publikoa John Nixonek egin zuen Independence Hall-eko lorategian, uztailaren 8an. Kopietako bat George Washingtoni bidali zioten uztailaren 6an, eta hark bere armadari irakurri zion uztailaren 9an, New Yorken. Abuztuaren 10ean, Londresera iritsi zen kopia bat. Biziraun duten dokumentuaren kopia zaharrenak dira oraindik existitzen diren Dunlapen 25 paperak. Eskuz idatzitako kopia originalak ez du iraun.
mt: After being approved by Congress on July 4, a rough draft handwritten by John Hancock, president of Congress, and Charles Thomson, secretary, was sent to nearby John Dunlap's printing house. Copies of the "Dunlap broadsides" were made that night, numbering between 150 and 200. The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon on July 8 in Independence Hall's yard. A copy was sent to George Washington on July 6, and he read it to his army on July 9 in New York. A copy arrived in London on August 10. The oldest surviving copies of the document are the 25 Dunlap broadsides that have survived. The original handwritten copy did not survive.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Kolonoek jarduera hori ikusi zutenean, errefortzuak batu zituzten haiek ere. Aurreko postuak sendotzen zituzten armadetan New Hampshireko 1. eta 3. erregimentuak zeuden, 200 gizonekin, John Stark eta James Reed koronelen agindupean (biak jeneral izendatu zituzten gero). Kolonoen kokapenaren iparraldeko muturrean zegoen hesian kokatu ziren Starken gizonak. Itsasbeherak Mystic ibaian hutsunea ireki zuenean, penintsularen ipar-ekialdean, hesia azkar luzatu zuten harrizko horma labur batekin, iparraldean bukatzen zena uraren ertzean, hondartza txiki batean. Gridleyk edo Starkek 100 oineko (30 m) hesola bat jarri zuen hesiaren aurrean eta erregularrek pasa arte tirorik ez egiteko agindua eman zuen.
mt: When the colonists saw the activity, they reinforced them as well. The previous posts were reinforced by the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments, with 200 men, under the command of John Stark and James Reed (both were later promoted to general). Stark's men were positioned at the northern end of the line. When the British opened a gap in the river at Mystic, on the peninsula's northeastern tip, the line was quickly extended with a short stone wall, ending in the north at the water's edge, at a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a 100-yard (30 m) fence in front of the line and ordered the regulars not to fire until the enemy passed.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Antzinako Txinak garai bakoitza erakusteko modu berezi bat zuen. Txinaren garai bakoitza edo boterea zuen familia bakoitza dinastia bereizgarri bat zen. Horrez gain, dinastien arteko tartean probintzia banatuen garai ezegonkor bat egoten zen. Garai horietatik ezagunena Hiru Erreinuen aroa izan zen, Han eta Jin dinastien artean 60 urte iraun zituena. Garai horietan, tronuagatik borrokan ari ziren nobleen arteko gerra ankerrak gertatzen ziren. Hiru Erreinuen aroa antzinako Txinako historiako garai odoltsuenetako bat izan zen; milaka pertsona hil ziren Xi’an-go jauregi handiko eserleku garaienean esertzeko eskubidea lortzeko borrokan.
mt: Ancient China had a unique way of marking each era or period of power. Each era or period of power was represented by a distinct dynasty. In between dynasties, there was an unstable period of provincial rule. The most famous of these periods was the Three Kingdoms, which lasted 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. During these periods, wars between the noble families fighting for the throne were common. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest periods in ancient Chinese history; thousands died in the struggle to sit on the throne of the Xi’an palace.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Inurri soldaduen koloniek fase desberdinak dituzte mugitzeko eta habia egiteko. Nomada fasean, inurri soldaduek gauez desfilatzen dute eta egunez kanpatzen. Eskura dagoen janaria murrizten denean sartzen da kolonia nomada fasean. Fase horretan, egunero aldatzen diren behin behineko habiak egiten ditu koloniak. Suntsiketa edo desfile nomada horietako bakoitzak 17 egun irauten du gutxi gorabehera.
mt: Ants in the soldier caste have different phases to move and build nests. In the nomadic phase, soldier ants march at night and sleep during the day. When food is scarce, the nomadic colony phase enters. In this phase, the colony builds temporary nests every day. Each nomadic destruction or parade lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Ziklo endogenoak eta erloju biologikoen bidezko haien produkzioak egotea erabakigarria da fisiologian eta portaeran antzeman diren erritmo askotarako. Erritmo periodikoak, zeinak ez diren kanpoko seinale periodikoen erantzun soilak, dokumentatu egin dira izaki bizidun gehienetan: bakterietan, onddoetan, landareetan eta animalietan. Erloju biologikoak osziladore autonomoak dira, beren kabuz denboraldi batez funtzionatzen jarraitzen dutenak nahiz eta kanpoko seinalerik ez egon.
mt: The presence of endogenous clocks and their production via biological oscillators is crucial for the physiology and behavior of many organisms. Periodic rhythms, which are not simple responses to periodic external signals, have been documented in most living organisms: bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological oscillators are autonomous oscillators that continue to function for a period of time without any external signal.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Zonalde geografiko zehatz batean dagoen espezie jakin bateko organismoen bilduma da populazioa. Populazio bateko banakoak berdinak direnean ezaugarri fenotipo zehatz bati dagokionez, monomorfiko deritze. Banakoek ezaugarri baten hainbat aldaera badituzte, polimorfikoak direla esaten da.
mt: A collection of organisms of a particular species in a specific geographic area is called a population. When all individuals in a population are the same in terms of a particular phenotypic trait, they are called monomorphic. If individuals have different forms of a trait, they are called polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Naturan oinarritutako turismoak eremu naturalak bisitatzeko interesa duen jendea erakartzen du, paisaiaz (fauna eta flora barne) gozatzeko helburuarekin doana. In situ jardueren adibide batzuk: ehiza, arrantza, argazkigintza, hegaztien behaketa, eta parkeak bisitatzea eta ekosistemari buruzko informazioa ikastea. Borneoko orangutanak bisitatzea, haien argazkiak ateratzea eta haiei buruz ikastea, esaterako.
mt: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery (including fauna and flora). Examples of in situ activities include hunting, fishing, photography, birdwatching, and visiting parks and learning about the ecosystem. Visiting orangutans in Borneo, taking their pictures, and learning about them, for example.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Goizero-goizero, jendea landa-eremuko herri txikietatik ateratzen da lanera joateko eta utzi berri duten tokian lan egiten duen jendearekin gurutzatzen da. Garraio-dinamika horren baitan, mundu guztia nolabait lotuta dago auto pribatuetan oinarritutako garraio-sistema batekin, eta hura babesten du. Zientziak adierazi duenez, izugarrizko karbono-ekonomia horrek aldatu egin du azken bi milioi urteetan biosferaren egoera egonkorra, zeinak gizakion eboluzioa babestu duen.
mt: In the morning, people from small rural villages are leaving to work and crossing with people who are working in the place they just left. In this traffic dynamics, the whole world is somehow connected with a private car-based transportation system, and that system is supported by it. Science has shown that this incredible carbon economy has changed the stable state of the biosphere in the last two million years, which has supported human evolution.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Materia oro eraikitzeko funtsezko ataletako bat kontsidera daiteke atomoa. Oso entitate konplexua da eta, Bohr eredu sinplifikatu baten arabera, elektroiek orbitatzen duten nukleo zentral batez osatuta dago, planetek eguzkia orbitatzen duten bezala, nolabait (ikus 1.1 irudia). Nukleoak bi partikula ditu: neutroiak eta protoiak. Protoiek karga elektriko positiboa dute eta neutroiek ez dute kargarik. Elektroiek, ordea, karga elektriko negatiboa dute.
mt: 1.1 The atom is considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of matter. It is a very complex entity and, according to the simplified Bohr model, is made up of a central nucleus surrounded by orbiting electrons, much like planets orbiting the sun (see Figure 1.1). The nucleus contains two particles: neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge and neutrons have no charge. Electrons, however, have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Gaur egun erabiltzen diren ia ordenagailu guztiak informazioaren manipulazioan oinarrituta daude, zeina zenbaki bitarrekin kodetuta dagoen. Zenbaki bitar batek bi balioetako bakarra izan dezake, adibidez 0 edo 1, eta zenbaki horiei zifra bitar deritze (edo ordenagailuen jargoian, bit).
mt: Today's computers are based on the manipulation of information, which is represented by binary digits (or bits in computer jargon), each of which can take one of two values, such as 0 or 1.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Gaur egun erabiltzen diren ia ordenagailu guztiak informazioaren manipulazioan oinarrituta daude, zeina zenbaki bitarrekin kodetuta dagoen. Zenbaki bitar batek bi balioetako bakarra izan dezake, adibidez 0 edo 1, eta zenbaki horiei zifra bitar deritze (edo ordenagailuen jargoian, bit).

src: Blogek ere lagun dezakete ikasleen idazkera hobetzen. Askotan ikasleek bloga gramatika eta ortografia kaskarrarekin hasten duten arren, irakurleak edukitzeak hori aldatu egin ohi du. Irakurle zorrotzenak ikasleak izaten direnez askotan, blogaren idazlea idazkera hobetzeko ahaleginak egiten hasten da kritikak saihesteko. Halaber, blogak idazteak “inguruan duten munduari buruz gehiago jakitera bultzatzen ditu ikasleak”. Ikasleak burutsu eta interesgarri izateko inspiratzen ditu irakurleen interesak asetzeko beharrak (Toto, 2004). Blogak idaztea elkarlana sustatzen duen tresna da, eta ohiko eskola-egunetik harago ezagutza zabaltzera animatzen ditu ikasleak. Blogen erabilera egokiak “ikasleak analitikoago eta kritikoago izateko ahaldundu ditzake; Interneteko materialei aktiboki erantzunez, ikasleek beren jarrera zehatz dezakete besteen idazlanen testuinguruan, baita auzi jakin batzuekiko beren ikuspuntua laburtu ere (Oravec, 2002).
mt: Blogs can also help students improve their writing. Often students start a blog with poor grammar and spelling, but the readers often change that. Often, the most critical readers are students themselves, and they start to make an effort to improve their writing to avoid criticism. Also, writing a blog can inspire students to learn more about the world around them. Blogs can be used to promote collaboration, and students can use them to share their knowledge outside of the classroom. The appropriate use of blogs can “help students become more analytical and critical; by actively responding to Internet materials, students can clarify their stance in the context of others’ writings, as well as summarize their position on certain issues (Oravec, 2002).
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Komunikazio asinkronoak hausnarketarako eta erreakzionatzeko denbora sustatzen du besteengan. Ikasleei aukera ematen die beren erritmoan lan egiteko eta hezkuntza-informazioaren erritmoa kontrolatzeko. Horretaz gain, lan egiteko ordu malguen aukerarekin, denbora-muga gutxiago daude (Bremer, 1998). Internetaren eta mundu zabaleko amaraunaren erabilerak informazioa edonoiz atzitzeko aukera ematen die ikasleei. Halaber, ikasleek eguneko edozein unetan bidal diezaiekete galderak irakasleei eta nahiko erantzun azkarrak espero, elkar ikusiko duten hurrengo unera arte itxaron beharrean.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows for time to think and react to others. It gives students the opportunity to work at their own pace and control the pace of information. In addition, there are fewer time constraints with flexible work hours (Bremer, 1998). The use of the Internet and the world wide web allows students to access information at any time. Students can also ask questions to teachers and expect quick responses, rather than waiting until the next time they see each other.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Erdi Aroko gaztelu tradizionalak luzaroan elikatu du irudimena, eta justak, oturuntzak zein Arturoren pareko kemena ekartzen ditu gogora. Mila urteko hondakinen artean zutik egonda ere, erraz ekar daitezke gogora aspaldiko borroken soinu eta usainak; ia entzun ere egin daiteke apatxek galtzada-harrietan egiten zuten zarata, eta usaindu lur azpiko ziegatatik igotzen zen beldurra. Baina gure irudimena errealitatean oinarrituta al dago? Hasteko, zergatik eraiki ziren gazteluak? Nola diseinatu eta eraiki ziren?
mt: Medieval castles have long fed the imagination, and justly, they conjure up images of feasts and Arthurian chivalry. Even among the ruins of a thousand years, it is easy to conjure up the sounds and smells of ancient battles; almost one can hear the clatter of hooves on the road, and smell the fear of the enemy as they charged from the underbrush. But is our imagination grounded in reality? First, why were castles built? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Garai hartan ohikoa zen bezala, Kirby Muxloe gaztelua etxe gotortu bat da gaztelu bat baino gehiago. Dituen beiradun leiho handiekin eta horma meheekin, ez lioke luzaroan aurre egingo eraso iraunkor bati. 1480ko hamarkadan, Lord Hastings hura eraikitzen hasi zenean, herrialdeak nahiko egoera baketsua zuen eta handik hona ibilian zebiltzan talde txikien kontrako defentsa besterik ez zen behar.
mt: As was common at the time, Kirby Muxloe Castle is a fortified house rather than a castle. Its large, glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to withstand a sustained attack. In the 1480s, when Lord Hastings began building it, the country was relatively peaceful and the only defence needed was against small bands of raiders.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Milia laurdeneko lasterketatik milia erdira aldatzean, abiadurak askoz garrantzi gutxiagoa dauka eta erresistentzia erabat beharrezkoa da. Zer esanik ez dago, milia erdiko korrikalari bikain batek, hau da bi minututik beherako denbora egin dezakeen gizon batek, abiadura nahiko behar du, baina erresistentzia landu beharko du nahi eta nahi ez. Neguan kros lasterketa batzuk egitea eta gorputzeko goi-atalak lantzeko gimnasioko ariketak egitea prestaketa onena da lasterketen denboraldirako.
mt: 2/3 of the way through a marathon, speed is not as important and endurance is absolutely necessary. There is no question that a very good half-marathon runner, that is someone who can run a 2 hour marathon, needs speed, but he needs endurance as well. Running cross country in the winter and doing upper body exercises in the gym is the best preparation for the marathon.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Elikadura ohitura egokiekin soilik ezin da eliteko errendimendua lortu, baina izugarri eragin dezake atleta gazteen osasun orokorrean. Energiaren oreka osasungarria mantentzeak, hidratazio ohitura eraginkorrak praktikatzeak eta osagarriak hartzearen alderdiak ulertzeak beren errendimendua hobetzen lagundu ahal die atletei, baita kirolaz gehiago gozatzen ere.
mt: Only with proper nutrition habits can elite performance be achieved, but it can greatly affect the overall health of young athletes. Maintaining energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the aspects of supplementation can help athletes improve their performance, as well as enjoy their sport more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Distantzia ertainean korrika egitea kirol merke samarra da; dena den, parte hartzeko behar den ekipamendu gutxiari buruzko ideia oker asko daude. Behar ahala eros daitezke produktuak, baina errendimenduan eragin gutxi edo batere ez dute izango gehienek. Gerta liteke atletek produktu bat nahiago izatea nahiz eta benetako onurarik ez eduki.
mt: 5k and 10k races are cheap; however, there are many misconceptions about the equipment needed to participate. Products can be purchased, but most will have little or no effect on performance. It is possible that athletes will prefer a product even if it has no real benefit.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: Erresonantzia magnetiko bidezko irudiak erresonantzia magnetiko nuklear (EMN) deritzon fenomeno fisiko batean oinarrituta daude, zeina Felix Blochek (Stanford Unibertsitatean lanean) eta Edward Purcellek (Harvard Unibertsitatekoa) aurkitu zuten 1930eko hamarkadan. Erresonantzia horretan, eremu magnetikoaren eta irrati-uhinen eraginez, atomoek irrati-seinale txiki-txikiak igortzen dituzte. 1970ean, Raymond Damadianek, medikua eta zientzia ikerlaria, erresonantzia magnetiko bidezko irudiak diagnostiko medikoak egiteko tresna gisa erabiltzeko oinarriak aurkitu zituen. Lau urte geroago, patente bat eman zen; erresonantzia magnetiko bidezko irudien arloan munduan egin zen lehenengo patentea. 1977an, Damadian doktoreak erresonantzia magnetiko bidezko irudien “gorputz osoko” eskanerraren eraketa osatu zuen, eta “Menderakaitza” izena jarri zion.
mt: Magnetic resonance images are based on the phenomenon of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (Harvard University) in the 1930s. In this phenomenon, atoms emit tiny radio signals in response to a magnetic field and radio waves. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a physician and scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance images as medical diagnostic tools. Four years later, a patent was granted; the first patent in the field of magnetic resonance images worldwide. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first “whole-body” magnetic resonance scanner, and named it “Indomitable”.
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Besteen pentsamenduak hoberen irakurtzen dituen espeziea dira gizakiak, gaindika. Horrek esan nahi du zuzen asmatzeko gai garela beste gizaki batzuek antzematen, sinesten edo nahi dutena, dakitena edo zer asmo duten. Gaitasun horien artean, beste batzuen asmoak ulertzea funtsezkoa da. Ekintza fisikoen anbiguotasun posibleak ebazteko aukera ematen digu. Esate baterako, norbait auto bateko leihoa apurtzen ikusiko bazenu, beste norbaiten autoa lapurtzen saiatzen ari dela pentsatuko zenuke ziurrenik. Autoko giltzak galdu, eta bere autoan sartzen saiatzen ari bazen, beste iritzi bat eduki beharko genuke.
mt: The species that best understand the thoughts of others are humans, upright. This means that we are able to guess what others are thinking, believing, or desiring. One of these abilities is to understand the intentions of others. This gives us the opportunity to clarify possible ambiguities in physical actions. For example, if you saw someone breaking a car window, you would probably think that they were trying to steal the car. If they were trying to open the door of their own car, you would have a different opinion.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

Autoko giltzak galdu, eta bere autoan sartzen saiatzen ari bazen, beste iritzi bat eduki beharko genuke.
mt: The species that best understand the thoughts of others are humans, upright. This means that we are able to guess what others are thinking, believing, or desiring. One of these abilities is to understand the intentions of others. This gives us the opportunity to clarify possible ambiguities in physical actions. For example, if you saw someone breaking a car window, you would probably think that they were trying to steal the car. If they were trying to open the door of their own car, you would have a different opinion.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Nahiz eta AAk zientzia fikziozko konnotazio sendoak dituen, informatikaren oso adar garrantzitsua da AA, makina baten portaera, ikasketa eta adimenaren egokitzapena biltzen dituena. AAri buruzko ikerketetan makinak prestatu egiten dira portaera adimenduna behar duten zereginak automatizatzeko. Adibide batzuk aipatzearren: kontrola, plangintza eta antolamendua, bezeroen diagnostikoei eta galderei erantzuteko gaitasuna, eta kaligrafia-, ahots- eta aurpegi-ezagutza. Gauza horiek diziplina bereizi bihurtu dira, bizitzako arazoetarako konponbideak emateko xedea dutenak. AA sistema askotan erabiltzen da ekonomia, medikuntza, ingeniaritza eta militar arloetan, baina baita etxeko ordenagailuetako eta bideojokoetako zenbait software aplikazioetan ere.
mt: While AA has strong connotations of science fiction, it is a very important subfield of computer science, which deals with the behavior, learning, and adaptation of machines. In AA research, machines are trained to perform tasks that require intelligent behavior. For example, control, planning, and scheduling, answering customer queries and diagnoses, and handwriting, speech, and face recognition. These have become separate disciplines, with the goal of finding solutions to real-world problems. AA is used in many fields, such as economics, medicine, engineering, and the military, but also in some software applications for home computers and video games.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Pentsamendu konbergentearen patroiak arazoak konpontzeko teknikak dira, eta hainbat ideia edo alor elkartzen dituzte irtenbide bat aurkitzeko. Pentsamolde hori abiaduran, logikan eta zehaztasunean oinarritzen da, baita gertakariak identifikatzean, eskuragarri dauden teknikak erabiltzean eta informazioa biltzean ere. Pentsamolde horren ezaugarri garrantzitsuena honako hau da: erantzun zuzen bakarra dago. Bi erantzun mota posible daude, beraz: zuzena edo okerra. Mota horretako pentsamenduak lotura estua du hainbat zientzia-prozedura edota prozedura estandarrekin. Horrela pentsatzen duten pertsonek pentsamendu logikoa dute eta patroiak memorizatzeko gai dira, baita arazoak konpontzeko eta zientzia-probetan lan egiteko ere.
mt: Patterns of convergent thinking are techniques for solving problems, and they bring together ideas or areas of knowledge to find a solution. This way of thinking is based on speed, logic, and precision, as well as identifying events, using available techniques, and gathering information. One of the most important characteristics of this way of thinking is that there is only one correct answer. There are two possible types of answers: correct or incorrect. People who think this way have logical thinking and are able to memorize patterns, as well as to solve problems and work in scientific experiments.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Bideo-grabazioak erabilita aurkikuntza garrantzitsuak egin dira mikroespresioak, milisegundo gutxi batzuk irauten dituzten aurpegiko mugimenduak, interpretatzeko garaian. Bereziki, mikroespresioak zuzen interpretatuta pertsona bat gezurretan ari den edo ez atzeman daitekeela esaten da. Oliver Sacks-ek, Presidentearen hitzaldia artikulu zientifikoan, adierazi zuen garunean kalteak pairatzeagatik hizketa ulertzeko gai ez diren pertsonak gai direla zintzotasuna zuzen atzemateko. Hark dioenez, giza portaera interpretatzeko gaitasun hori beste animalia batzuek ere badute, adibidez txakur etxekotuek.
mt: Important discoveries have been made in the interpretation of microexpressions, facial movements that last for a few milliseconds. In particular, microexpressions can be used to detect whether a person is lying or not. Oliver Sacks, in a scientific article about the President's speech, said that people who are unable to understand speech due to brain damage are able to detect honesty. He says that this ability to interpret human behavior is also found in other animals, such as domesticated dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Goian aipatu bezala, ezagutza eskuratzeko eta ikasteko gaitasuna aldatu zen modua dela-eta, aldatu egin zen ezagutza jasotzeko oinarrizko erritmoa ere. Informazioa eskuratzeko hurbilketa ezberdina zen. Presioa dagoeneko ez zegoen banako bakoitzak gogoratzeko zuen gaitasunean; horren ordez, testua gogoratzeko gaitasuna bihurtu zen helburu. Oro har, errenazimenduan aldaketa nabarmena gertatu zen ezagutza ikasteko eta hura hedatzeko hurbilketari dagokionez.
mt: As knowledge acquisition and learning methods changed, so did the basic rhythm of acquiring knowledge. The approach to acquiring information was different. Pressure was not yet on the individual to remember what he or she had learned; instead, the goal was to remember the text. Overall, there was a marked change in the approach to learning and disseminating knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Internetek komunikazio masiboaren eta pertsonen arteko komunikazioaren elementuak konbinatzen ditu. Interneten ezaugarri anitzei esker, erabilera eta gogobetetasunari lotutako alderdi osagarriei bide eman zaie. Esaterako, “ikastea” eta “sozializatzea” omen dira Internet erabiltzeko motibazio nagusiak (James et al., 1995). “Inplikazio pertsonala” eta “harreman jarraitua” ere motibazio-alderdi gisa identifikatu zituzten Eighmey eta McCord-ek (1998), jendeak webguneekiko zuen erreakzioa ikertu zutenean.
mt: Internet combines the elements of mass communication and interpersonal communication.  With the characteristics of the Internet, the elements of motivation and satisfaction are combined. For example, "learning" and "socialization" are the main motivations for using the Internet (James et al., 1995). "Personal involvement" and "continuing relationship" were also identified as motivation elements (Eighmey and McCord, 1998) when people reacted to websites.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Estilo gotikoaren gailurra 10. eta 11. mendeen eta 14. mendearen artean gertatu zen. Hasieran, ekialdeko Bizantzioko kulturaren eragin handia izan zuten jantziek. Hala ere, komunikazio-bideak mantsoak zirenez, estiloak 25 eta 30 urteko atzerapenarekin iristen ziren mendebaldera. Erdi Aroaren amaiera aldera, mendebaldeko Europa bere estilo propioa garatzen hasi zen. Gurutzatuak arropa lotzeko botoiak erabiltzen hasi zirenean etorri zen garai hartako berrikuntzarik handienetako bat.
mt: The high point of Gothic style was in the 10th and 11th centuries and the 14th century. Initially, the fashions had a great influence from the Eastern Byzantine culture. However, communication channels were slow, and styles took 25 to 30 years to reach the West. At the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. The use of buttons to fasten clothing was one of the most important innovations of that time.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Ingurumenarekiko modu garbiagoan bizitzen has gaitezke, ingurumenaren aldeko mobilizazioekin bat egin dezakegu, eta aktibista ere izan gaitezke etorkizuneko sufrimendua hein batean murrizteko. Tratamendu sintomatikoa bezalakoa da kasu askotan. Hala ere, behin behineko soluzioa besterik nahi ez badugu, arazoen jatorria aurkitu behar dugu haiek konpondu ahal izateko. Begien bistan dago mundua asko aldatu dela gizadiaren aurrerapen zientifiko eta teknologikoei esker, eta arazoak areagotu egin direla gainpopulazioaren eta gizadiaren bizimodu xahutzailearen ondorioz.
mt: We can live more sustainably, join environmental movements, and be activists to reduce future suffering. Symptomatic treatment is often like that. But if I don't want a temporary solution, I need to find the root of the problems to solve them. It is obvious that the world has changed a lot thanks to scientific and technological advances of humanity, and problems have worsened due to overpopulation and the wasteful lifestyle of humanity.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Botere-orekaren sistemaren bidez, Europako nazioek Europako estatu guztien subiranotasun nazionala mantentzeko helburua zuten. Kontzeptuaren arabera, Europako nazio guztien lana zen nazio bat bestea baino boteretsuago ez bihurtzea, eta, beraz, gobernu nazionalek aliantzak maiz aldatzen zituzten oreka horri eusteko. Espainiako Ondorengotza Gerra izan zen botere-oreka hori gatazkaren arrazoi nagusi izan zuen lehen gerra. Horrek aldaketa garrantzitsua ekarri zuen, ordutik aurrera Europako nazio boteretsuek ez baitzuten erlijio-gerraren aitzakiarik behar izan. Horrenbestez, Hogeita Hamar Urteko Gerra izan zen erlijio-gerra gisa izendatu zen azkena.
mt: The concept was that the work of all European nations was to keep the balance of power between one nation and another, and thus governments changed alliances frequently to maintain this balance. The Spanish Succession War was the first war to be the main reason for the balance of power. This brought about a significant change, as since then, powerful European nations have not needed a religious war as a pretext. Thus, the War of the Spanish Succession was the last war to be named a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Europako historiaren garai horretan, zorrotz aztertzen hasi ziren Eliza Katolikoa, zeina aberats eta boteretsu bilakatu baitzen. Mila urte baino gehiagoz, Kristautasunak Europako estatuak elkartu egin zituen, hizkuntza eta ohitura ezberdinak izan arren. Haren botere ahalguztidunak guztiei eragiten zien, erregetik hasi eta herritar xeheetara bitarte. Kristautasunaren printzipio nagusietako bat da aberastasuna sufrimendua eta pobrezia arintzeko erabili behar dela eta elizaren diru-funtsak zehazki helburu horretarako direla. Elizaren aginte zentrala Erroman finkatuta egon zen mila urtez baino gehiagoz, eta botere- eta diru-kontzentrazio horrek printzipio hori betetzen ote zen ala ez zalantza sortu zuen askorengan.
mt: In this period of European history, the Catholic Church was closely examined, as it had become wealthy and powerful. For over a thousand years, Christianity had united the states of Europe, despite differences in language and custom. Its all-powerful authority affected everyone, from kings to commoners. One of the main principles of Christianity is that wealth should be used to relieve suffering and poverty, and that the Church's funds should be used for this purpose. The central authority of the Church was located in Rome for over a thousand years, and this concentration of power and money raised questions in many minds as to whether this principle was being followed.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Beldurrez ikaratuta zegoen Luis XVI.a erregea, Maria Antonieta erregina eta haien bi seme-alaba gazteak (11 urteko Maria Teresa eta lau urteko Luis-Karlos) eta erregearen ahizpa Elizabeth Versailles-etik Parisera itzultzera behartu zituen azokako emakumeen talde handi batek 1789ko urriaren 6an. Zalgurdian itzuli ziren Parisera erregearen eta erreginaren kontrako mehatxuak oihukatzen zituen jendetza zaratatsuak lagunduta. Jendetzak zalgurdiko leihoak guztiz irekita izatera behartu zituen errege eta erregina. Une jakin batean, jendetzako kide batek Versailles-en hildako errege-guardia baten burua astindu zuen erregina beldurtuaren aurrean.
mt: 6 October 1789: Fearing for his life, Louis XVI, Marie Antoinette and their two young children (11-year-old Marie-Thérèse and 4-year-old Louis-Charles) and the king's sister Elizabeth were forced to leave Versailles for Paris by a large mob of women from the market. They returned to Paris in a royal coach, surrounded by a jeering mob shouting threats against the king and queen. The mob forced the coach to stop and the windows to be opened. At one point, a member of the mob struck the head of a dead royal guard in front of the terrified queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Oldarraldiak piztu eta berehala, Britainia Alemaniaren itsasontziak blokeatzen hasi zen. Oinarrizko hornigai militar eta zibilen sarrera etetea estrategia eraginkorra izan zen, baina blokeo horrek urratu egiten zuen azken bi mendeetako nazioarteko hitzarmen ugariren bidez kodifikatutako eta oro har onartutako nazioarteko legedia. Britainiak nazioarteko uretan minak jarri zituen ontziei ozeanoko zati handietan sartzeko aukera galaraziz eta itsasontzi neutroei ere arriskua eraginez. Taktika honi erantzun mugatua eman zitzaionez, Alemaniak abian zuen mugarik gabeko ur azpiko gerrak ere antzeko erantzuna izatea espero zuen.
mt: Britain's blockade of German shipping was immediately followed by British mines being laid in international waters, effectively blocking access to the ocean for German ships and also posing a risk to neutral ships.  Germany, in turn, expected a similar response to the unrestricted submarine warfare it was conducting.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Ameriketako Estatu Batuetan, Esklerosi Anizkoitzaren (EA) 400.000 kasu daude gutxi gorabehera, eta heldu gazteen eta adin ertainekoen artean gaixotasun neurologiko nagusi bihurtzen du datu horrek. Nerbio-sistema zentralari eragiten dion gaixotasuna da EA, zeina entzefaloak, bizkarrezur-muinak eta ikusmen-nerbioak osatzen duten. Ikerketen arabera, emakumeek EA edukitzeko probabilitate bikoitza dute gizonekin alderatuta.
mt: 400,000 cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) are estimated to exist in the United States, making it the most common neurological disorder among young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which includes the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerves. Research indicates that women are twice as likely to have MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Ikerketan frogatu egin zen lunbalgia zuten gaixoetan depresioa, beldurra eta pentsaera katastrofista zirela minaren eta ezintasunaren arteko harremanaren bitartekari. Pentsaera katastrofistaren eraginak ziren soilik ariketa fisiko antolatuak astero edukitzearen araberakoak, eta ez depresioa ezta beldurra. Ariketa erregularki egiten zutenek behar zuten laguntza handiagoa minaren pertzepzio negatiboari zegokionez, min kronikoaren eta mugimendu fisiko arruntak sortutako deserosotasunaren arteko aldea desberdintzeko.
mt: A study found that people with fibromyalgia were more likely to be depressed, anxious and have a catastrophic thinking style. The effects of catastrophic thinking were only seen in those who did regular exercise, not in those who were depressed or anxious. Those who exercised regularly needed more help in dealing with negative perceptions of pain, to distinguish between chronic pain and normal physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Eskrima kirol modernoa maila askotan jokatzen da: unibertsitatean ikasten ari diren ikasleen mailan nahiz profesionalen eta txapelketa olinpikoen mailan. Duelu formatuan egiten da oro har, lehiakide bat bestearen kontra.
mt: Fencing is played at many levels: at the university level, at the professional level, and at the Olympic level. It is usually played in a duel format, with one competitor against another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Baliteke hesteetako intoxikazioa agerikoa ez izatea segituan. Oka egitea eta bestelako sintomak orokorregiak direnez, ezin da berehalako diagnostikorik egin. Sendagaien edo etxea garbitzeko produktu kimiko toxikoen pote ireki bat da hesteetako intoxikazioaren adierazgarri onena. Irakur ezazu etiketa, pozoi jakin horretarako lehen sorospenak zein diren jakiteko.
mt: It is possible that the symptoms of poisoning are not immediately apparent.  Because the symptoms are often nonspecific, a diagnosis cannot be made immediately.  A bottle of household cleaner or other toxic chemical is the best indicator of poisoning.  Read the label to find out what the first signs of poisoning are.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Biktima ikuskatzeko, egoera aztertu behar duzu lehenengo, zure segurtasuna bermatzeko. Biktimarengana hurbildu ahala, haren jarrera begiratu behar duzu, eta berehalako alarma seinalerik dagoen aztertu. Laguntzen saiatzen ari zarenean min hartzen baduzu, egoera okertzeko besterik ez du balioko.
mt: 1. First, assess the situation to ensure your safety. 2. As you approach the victim, observe their condition and look for signs of immediate danger. 3. If you are injured, you will be of no help to anyone.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Hainbat eragin sozial eta politiko daude: adibidez, sistema metrikoaren erabilera, absolutismotik errepublikanismorako aldaketa, nazionalismoa eta herrialdea agintari bakarrarena izan beharrean biztanleena izatearen ustea. Iraultzaren ondoren, lanpostuak gizonezko guztien esku jarri ziren, eta, horri esker, anbizio eta arrakasta gehien zutenek egin zuten aurrera. Berdin gertatu zen militarrekin, armadako maila klasean oinarrituta egon beharrean, kalibrean oinarrituta baitzegoen orain. Horrez gain, Frantziako Iraultzak beste herrialde batzuetako langile-klaseak inspiratu zituen bakoitzak bere iraultza abian jartzeko.
mt: There are many social and political effects: for example, the use of the metric system, the change from absolutism to republicanism, the belief that the nation is the people and not the state. After the revolution, jobs were given to all men, and those who were most ambitious and successful advanced. The same was true of the military, which was based on rank by class, but was now based on rank by caliber. In addition, the French Revolution inspired the working classes of other countries to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Mundu guztiak hartzen du parte gizartean eta garraio-sistemak erabiltzen ditu. Ia guztiak dira garraio-sistemen kexu. Herrialde garatuetan oso gutxitan entzuten dira uraren kalitateari edo zubiek behea jotzeari buruzko hainbeste kexa. Zergatik sorrarazten dituzte garraio-sistemek horrelako kexak? Zergatik huts egiten dute egunero? Garraio-teknikariak kualifikatu gabeak al dira? Edo oinarrizko arazoren bat dago?
mt: 99% of the world uses public transport. 99% of the world complains about public transport. In developed countries, you rarely hear complaints about the quality of water or the bridges sagging. Why do public transport systems generate so many complaints? Why do they fail so often? Are public transport engineers unqualified? Or is there a basic problem?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Gidari eta ibilgailu indibidualek bi helmugen artean duten mugimendua eta elkarren arteko harremanak aztertzen ditu trafikoaren fluxuak. Zoritxarrez, trafikoaren fluxua aztertzea zaila da gidarien portaera ezin delako erabateko ziurtasunez aurreikusi. Zorionez, gidariek nahiko portaera erregularra dute; beraz, trafiko-korronteak aski koherenteak dira eta matematikoki adieraz daitezke gutxi gorabehera. Trafikoaren fluxua hobeki adierazteko, harremanak hiru ezaugarri nagusitan zehaztu dira: (1) fluxua, (2) dentsitatea eta (3) abiadura. Errepideko zerbitzuen plangintzan, diseinuan eta zuzenbidean laguntzen dute harreman horiek.
mt: 1. Traffic flow is the movement and interaction of individual vehicles between two lanes. Unfortunately, traffic flow is difficult to analyze because the behavior of drivers cannot be completely predicted. Fortunately, drivers have relatively regular behavior; thus, traffic flows are reasonably coherent and can be mathematically described approximately. To better describe traffic flow, interactions are characterized by three main features: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. Traffic flows are used to assist in planning, design, and regulation of road services.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Hershey eta Chase esperimentua izan zen DNA material genetikoa zela frogatzen zuen aztarna nagusienetako bat. Hersheyk eta Chasek fagoak edo birusak erabili zituzten beren DNA bakterio batean txertatzeko. Bi esperimentu egin zituzten: fagoaren DNA fosforo erradiaktibo batekin markatu edo fagoaren proteina sulfuro erradiaktiboarekin markatu.
mt: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the main landmarks in the discovery of DNA as the genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages or viruses to infect a bacterium with their DNA. They performed two experiments: marking the phage DNA with radioactive phosphorus or marking the phage protein with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutazioek askotariko eraginak izan ditzakete mutazio motaren arabera, eragiten dion material genetiko zatiaren esanahiaren arabera eta eragiten dieten zelulak lerro germinaleko zelulak diren edo ez. Lerro germinaleko zeluletako mutazioak soilik pasatzen zaizkie haurrei, eta beste tokietako mutazioek zelulen heriotza edo minbizia eragin dezakete.
mt: Mutations can have a wide range of effects depending on the type of mutation, the meaning of the affected genetic material, and whether the affected cells are germline cells or not. Germline mutations only occur in children, and other mutations can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Mutazioek askotariko eraginak izan ditzakete mutazio motaren arabera, eragiten dion material genetiko zatiaren esanahiaren arabera eta eragiten dieten zelulak lerro germinaleko zelulak diren edo ez. Lerro germinaleko zeluletako mutazioak soilik pasatzen zaizkie haurrei, eta beste tokietako mutazioek zelulen heriotza edo minbizia eragin dezakete.

src: Dirudienez, ahuntzak duela 10.000 bat urte etxekotu zituzten lehenengo aldiz, Irango Zagros mendietan. Esnea, ilea, haragia eta larrua erraz lortzeko hasi ziren antzinako kulturak eta tribuak ahuntzak hazten. Ahuntz-artaldeetan mantentzen ziren normalean, mendixketan edo bestelako bazka-eremuetan aritzen zirenak, haurrak edo nerabeak izaten ziren ahuntzainen zaintzapean, ezagunagoak diren artzainen antzekoak. Artzain-lan metodo horiek gaur egun ere erabiltzen dira.
mt: 10,000 years ago, sheep were first domesticated in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Milk, wool, meat and skin were easily obtained by ancient cultures and tribes who began to raise sheep. They were usually kept in herds in mountainous or other grazing areas, with young or adolescent sheep being cared for by the sheepherders, similar to the better known shepherds. These sheepherding methods are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golfean, jokalariek golfeko makilak erabiltzen dituzte pilotak zuloetan sartzeko. Hemezortzi zulotan jolasten da erronda arrunt batean; normalean, lehenengo zuloan hasten dira jokalariak, eta hemezortzigarrenean bukatu. Zirkuitua osatzeko kolpe edo golf-makilarekin swing gutxien egiten dituen jokalariak irabazten du. Belarrean jolasten da, eta zuloaren inguruko belarra motzago ebakita dago eta green-a deritzo.
mt: In golf, golfers use golf clubs to hit balls into holes. There are 18 holes in a regular round; usually, players start at the first hole and finish at the eighteenth. The course is won by the player who takes the fewest strokes or golf clubs with a swing. It is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is cut shorter and is called the green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

mt: In golf, golfers use golf clubs to hit balls into holes. There are 18 holes in a regular round; usually, players start at the first hole and finish at the eighteenth. The course is won by the player who takes the fewest strokes or golf clubs with a swing. It is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is cut shorter and is called the green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Metodo zientifikoa baliatuta, munduak nola funtzionatzen duen jakitea da zientziaren helburu nagusia. Izan ere, metodo horrek bideratzen ditu ikerketa zientifiko gehienak. Dena den, esperimentazioa ez da egin behar den gauza bakarra; halaber, hipotesi posible bat edo gehiago baztertzeko erabiltzen den proba bat da esperimentua, galderak eginez, eta behaketak ere gidatzen du ikerketa zientifikoa.
mt: The scientific method is the process by which science is conducted. It is a process in which a problem is identified, a hypothesis is formed, predictions are made, and the predictions are tested. The scientific method is a process by which scientists try to neutralize their biases to get as close to the objective truth as possible.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tornadoek eremu txiki bat kolpatzen dute beste ekaitz bortitzekin alderatuta, baina den-dena suntsi dezakete haien ibilbidean. Zuhaitzak altxatu, eraikinetako oholak erauzi, eta autoak zerura aireratzen dituzte tornadoek. Tornado bortitzenen ehuneko bik hiru ordu baino gehiago irauten dute. Ekaitz ikaragarri horien haizeek 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 milia orduko) abiadura izatera iristen dira.
mt: Tornadoes are small in area compared to other severe storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Trees are uprooted, roofs are torn off houses, and cars are tossed into the air by tornadoes. The winds of these terrifying storms can reach speeds of 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Milaka urte daramate gizakiak leiar handitzaileak egiten eta erabiltzen. Hala ere, benetako lehen teleskopioak Europan egin ziren XVI. mendearen bukaeran. Teleskopio horiek bi leiar konbinatzen zituzten urruneko objektuak hurbilago eta handiago ikusteko.
mt: Humans have been using and making lenses for thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe at the end of the 16th century. These telescopes combined two lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Muhammad-ek interes bizia zuen eguneroko bizitzatik haratagoko gaietan. Haitzulo batera joaten zen maiz kontenplazioa egitera; tokiari “Hira” izena eman zitzaion, eta “Noor” (argia) mendian zegoen. Haitzuloak, denboran iraun egin duenak, argi erakusten du Muhammad-en joera espirituala. Meka iparraldeko mendietako baten gainean dagoen haitzuloa mundutik guztiz bakartuta dago. Are gehiago, kokapena jakinda ere, ez da aurkitzeko erraza. Haitzuloaren barruan, bakardadea osoa da. Goiko zeru garbi eta ederra eta inguruko mendiak besterik ezin da ikusi. Mundu honetako gutxi ikusi edo entzun daiteke haitzuloaren barrutik.
mt: Muhammad was interested in the afterlife. He often went to a cave for contemplation; the place was called "Hira", and "Noor" (light) was on the mountain. The cave, which has lasted over time, shows Muhammad's spiritual direction. The cave is located on a mountain in the north of Makkah. It is completely isolated from the world. Even more, it is not easy to find it, even knowing its location. In the cave, solitude is complete. Only the clear and beautiful sky above and the mountains around can be seen. Little can be seen or heard from the world about the cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Orgabideak jada XVI. mendean eraikitzen zituzten Ingalaterran. Orgabideak zurezko ohol paraleloak baino ez ziren arren, zaldiek arrastaka eramateari esker, garaiko bide latzetan abiadura handiagoa hartu eta karga pisutsuagoa eraman zezaketen. Habetzanak nahiko goiz gehitu ziren errailak finkatzeko. Pixkanaka, ordea, ohartu ziren errailak eraginkorragoak izango zirela gainean burdinazko zerrenda bat izango balute. Ohikoa bilakatu zen, baina burdinaren eraginez, orgen zurezko gurpilak gehiago higatzen ziren. Azkenean zurezko gurpilak burdinazko gurpilekin ordeztu zituzten. 1767an, burdin hutsez egindako lehen errailak erabili ziren.
mt: In the 16th century, England was building roads.  Roads were made of parallel wooden planks, but horses could carry more weight and go faster on them than on dirt roads.  Hitches were added to hold the planks in place.  Over time, they realized that rails would be more effective if they were held in place by a metal strip on top.  This became common, but the wooden wheels of the carts were worn down by the metal.  Eventually, the wooden wheels were replaced with metal wheels.  In 1767, the first rails made of iron were used.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
