src: Erromantizismoak Goethe, Fichte, Schlegel eta antzeko idazleetatik eratorritako determinismo kulturalaren elementu garrantzitsua izan zuen. Erromantizismoaren testuinguruan, geografiak banakoak moldatu egiten zituen, eta denborak aurrera egin ahala, geografia horrekin erlazionatutako ohiturak eta kulturak sortzen ziren. Azken horiek gizartearen tokiarekin bat egiten zutenez, era arbitrarioan inposatutako legeak baino hobeak ziren.
mt: The cultural determinism of the Romantics was an important element of the Romantic movement, which was influenced by writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, geography shaped individuals, and over time, cultures and traditions associated with that geography were created. Because these cultures were associated with a particular place, they were better than arbitrary laws imposed.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: Determinismo teknologikoak ideia asko barne hartzen ditu praktikan; dela teknologiak eragiten duen bulkada edo beharra, dela gizakion patua lege zientifikoen (eta horiek teknologian agertzeko moduaren) araberako logika ezkutu batek gidatzen duelako ustea. Determinismo teknologikoaren interpretazio gehienek honako bi ideia orokor hauek dituzte komunean: alde batetik, teknologiaren garapena edozein botere politiko edo kultural baino harago doala, eta, bestetik, teknologiak, aldi berean, “eragina” duela gizarteetan berez, gizarteek teknologian dutena baino gehiago. Esaterako, esan liteke motordun autoak izateak errepideen garapena dakarrela ezinbestean. Hala ere, nazio mailako errepide sare bat ez da ekonomikoki bideragarria auto gutxi batzuk bakarrik badaude; beraz, ekoizpen metodo berriak garatzen dira autoak izatea merkeagoa izan dadin. Autoen jabetza zenbat eta masiboagoa izan, orduan eta istripu gehiago gertatzen dira errepideetan; baina, horrek, era berean, zaurituak artatzeko teknika berriak sortzea eragiten du osasun arloan.
mt: 1. Technological determinism encompasses a number of ideas in practice; either the wave or need of technology, or the belief that human destiny is guided by a hidden logic of scientific laws (and the way in which these laws manifest themselves in technology). Most interpretations of technological determinism have two common overarching ideas: on the one hand, that the development of technology is beyond any political or cultural power, and, on the other hand, that technology, simultaneously, “has an effect” on societies more than societies have on technology. For example, it can be said that the existence of motor vehicles leads to the development of roads. However, a national road network is not economically feasible if there are only a few cars; therefore, new production methods are developed to make cars cheaper. The more widespread car ownership is, the more accidents occur on the roads; but, this, in turn, leads to new techniques being developed to treat injuries in the field of health.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: “Arkua gora mugitzeko” markak V forma du eta “arkua behera mugitzeko” markak, berriz, grapa baten edo beheko aldea faltan duen laukiaren forma du. Gora egiteak esan nahi du puntan hasi eta arkua bultzatu behar duzula, eta behera egiteak esan nahi du oinarrian (arkua eusten duzun lekuan) hasi eta arkutik tira egin behar duzula. Gorantz mugitutako arkuak soinu leunagoa egiten du, eta beheranzkoan soinu sendo eta trinkoagoa sortzen da. Zure markak egin ditzakezu arkatzez, baina inprimatutako arku-markak arrazoi musikalengatik jarri dira, eta, beraz, errespetatu egin beharko lirateke.
mt: “Up” marks have a V shape, and “down” marks, a shape like a capital letter U or a square with the bottom missing. “Up” means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and “down” means you should start at the bottom (where the bow is held) and pull the bow. Bows that are played up produce a softer sound, and those played down produce a louder, more resonant sound. You can make your own bow marks with chalk, but the printed bow marks are there for musical reasons, and should be respected.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: “Arkua gora mugitzeko” markak V forma du eta “arkua behera mugitzeko” markak, berriz, grapa baten edo beheko aldea faltan duen laukiaren forma du. src: Beste primateek ez bezala, hominidoek ez dituzte haien eskuak erabiltzen lokomoziorako, pisuari eusteko edo zuhaitz batetik bestera zintzilik aritzeko. Txinpantzearen eskuek eta oinek antzeko tamaina eta luzera dute, eta ezaugarri horrek ukabilekin ibiltzean eskuek pisuari eusteko duten erabilera islatzen du. Gizakien eskuak oinak baino laburragoak dira eta falange zuzenagoak dituzte. Duela bi eta hiru milioi urteko eskuetako hezur fosilizatuek erakusten dute eskuek izan zuten lokomoziotik manipulaziorako espezializazio-aldaketa hori.
mt: Unlike other primates, hominids do not use their hands for locomotion, to support weight, or to swing from tree to tree.  The hands and feet of chimpanzees are similar in size and length, and this characteristic reflects the use of hands to support weight in bipedal walking.  Human hands are shorter than feet and have more straight fingers.  Fossils of hands from two to three million years ago show the hand's specialization from locomotion to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Hogeigarren mendeko ikerketek erakutsi dutenez, aldaera genetikoen bi multzo daude: ezkutukoak eta adierazitakoak. Mutazioek aldaera genetiko berriak gehitzen dituzte, eta hautaketak, berriz, kendu egiten ditu adierazitako aldaeren multzotik. Bereizketak eta errekonbinazioak aldaerak multzo batetik bestera aldatzen ditu belaunaldi bakoitzean.
mt: 20th century research has shown that there are two types of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutations add new genetic variations, and selection, on the other hand, removes them from the pool of expressed variations. Divergence and recombination change the variations from one generation to the next.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: Sabanan, gizakien antzeko digestio-sistema duen primate batentzat zaila da eskura dituen landare-baliabideetatik beharrezkoak dituen aminoazidoak lortzea. Are gehiago, ez lortzeak ondorio larriak izan ditzake: hazkuntza murriztua, malnutrizioa eta, azkenik, heriotza. Hostoetan eta lekaleetan dauden proteinak izango lirateke eskuragarrien dituzten landare-baliabideak, baina gu bezalako primateentzat digeritzeko zailak dira prestatu gabe daudenean. Aldiz, animalia-elikagaiek (inurriak, termitak, arrautzak), digeritzeko errazak izateaz gain, oinarrizko aminoazido guztiak dituzten kalitate handiko proteinak dituzte. Guztia kontuan hartuz gero, ez litzateke harrigarria suertatu beharko jakitea gure aitzindariek “proteinen arazoa” sabanako txinpantzeek gaur egiten duten era bertsuan konpondu izana.
mt: In the savanna, it is difficult for primates with a digestive system similar to ours to obtain the amino acids necessary from the plant resources available to them. Moreover, not obtaining them can have serious consequences: reduced growth, malnutrition, and finally death. The proteins found in leaves and legumes would be the most easily available plant resources, but for primates like us, they are difficult to digest when not prepared. On the other hand, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs), in addition to being easily digested, have high quality proteins with all the essential amino acids. Taking all this into account, it would not be surprising to find out that our ancestors solved the "protein problem" in the same way as savanna chimpanzees do today.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

mt: In the savanna, it is difficult for primates with a digestive system similar to ours to obtain the amino acids necessary from the plant resources available to them. Moreover, not obtaining them can have serious consequences: reduced growth, malnutrition, and finally death. The proteins found in leaves and legumes would be the most easily available plant resources, but for primates like us, they are difficult to digest when not prepared. On the other hand, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs), in addition to being easily digested, have high quality proteins with all the essential amino acids. Taking all this into account, it would not be surprising to find out that our ancestors solved the "protein problem" in the same way as savanna chimpanzees do today.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Azpikulturek pentsatzeko era antzekoa duten eta gizarteko estandarretatik kanpo daudela sentitzen duten banakoak elkartzen dituzte eta identitate-sentsazio bat garatzeko aukera ematen diete. Azpikulturak bereizteko modu asko daude, hala nola adina, etnizitatea, klasea, kokapena edo generoa. Azpikultura bat zehazten duten ezaugarriak linguistikoak, estetikoak, erlijiozkoak, politikoak, sexualak, geografikoak edo faktoreen konbinazio bat izan daitezke. Azpikultura bateko kideek haien kidetza erakusteko estiloaren erabilera bereizgarri eta sinbolikoa egiten dute, eta hor sartzen dira modak, berezitasunak eta argota.
mt: People who feel different from the social norm and are not accepted by the mainstream society are brought together by subcultures and are given the opportunity to develop an identity. There are many ways to define a subculture, such as age, ethnicity, class, location or gender. The characteristics that define a subculture can be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture use distinctive and symbolic styles of expression to indicate their membership, and are thus included in fashions, peculiarities and slang.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Haurrak nahiko gazte direla konturatzen dira arrazez eta arraza-estereotipoez, eta arraza-estereotipo horiek portaeran eragiten dute. Adibidez, eskolan lan gutxi egiten duten estereotipoa duen gutxiengo arraza batekin identifikatzen diren haurrek eskolan emaitza okerragoak izateko joera izaten dute haien arrazarekin erlazionatutako estereotipoaren berri izaten dutenean.
mt: Children are aware of their race and racial stereotypes at a young age, and these stereotypes affect behavior. For example, children who identify with a racial group that is stereotyped as doing poorly in school tend to perform worse in school when they are reminded of their race and its associated stereotypes.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: Sozializazioaren garrantzia erakusteko erabiltzen den metodo ohikoenetako bat da hazten ari zirela, utzikeria, zorigaitzak edo berariazko abusuak tarteko, helduekin sozializatzeko aukerarik izan ez zuten haurren kasu zorigaiztokoak. Haur horiei “basati” esaten zaie. Haur basati batzuk pertsonek giltzapetu zituzten (normalean beren gurasoek), beste batzuetan haurrak alde batera uzten zituzten gurasoek, ez zituztelako onartzen haur baten desgaitasun intelektual edo fisiko larriak. Litekeena da haur basatiek haurtzaroan abusu edo trauma larriak bizi izana bakarrik utzi edo ihes egin aurretik. Beste batzuk, ustez, animaliek hazi dituzte; esaten dutenez, beste batzuk beren kabuz bizi izan dira naturan. Gizakiak ez diren animaliek hazitako haur basatien kasuan, zaintza-animalia jakin horren ia guztiz berdinak diren portaerak izan ohi dituzte (muga fisikoen barruan), hala nola gizakiekiko beldurra edo interes falta.
mt: One of the most common methods used to demonstrate the importance of socialization is the case of children who, during their upbringing, were not given the opportunity to socialize with adults due to their disability, mental or physical. Such children are called "feral". Some feral children were kept in captivity (usually by their parents), others were abandoned by their parents who did not accept their child's severe disability. It is likely that feral children have experienced severe abuse or trauma before or after running away. Some are said to have been raised by animals; others are said to have lived in the wild on their own. Feral children raised by non-human animals tend to have behaviors that are almost identical to those of the particular animal species that raised them (within species boundaries), such as fear of humans or lack of interest.
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Nekazarien eta haien familien beharrei erantzuteko bezainbeste elikagai ekoizteko egiten den nekazaritzari iraupen-nekazaritza deritzo. Iraupen-nekazaritza sistema sinplea da, maiz organikoa, eta ekoeskualdekoak diren gordetako haziak eta laboreen errotazioa edo antzeko teknika sinpleak erabiltzen ditu ahalik eta uzta handiena lortzeko. Historikoki, baserritar gehienek iraupen-nekazaritza egiten zuten, eta hala gertatzen da oraindik ere garatze bidean dauden herrialde askotan.
mt: Sustained agriculture is the practice of producing as much food as possible for the needs of farmers and their families. Sustained agriculture is a simple system, often organic, that uses stored seeds and rotation of crops or similar simple techniques to maximize harvest. Historically, most farmers practiced sustained agriculture, and this is still the case in many developing countries that are still on the path of development.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Baliteke turismo mota ohikoena jende gehienak bidaiatzearekin lotzen duena izatea: aisialdiko turismoa. Jendea bere eguneroko bizitzaren oso bestelakoa den toki batera joatean datza, atseden hartzeko eta ongi pasatzeko. Hondartzak, parke tematikoak eta kanpalekuak dira aisialdiko turistek gehien bisitatzen dituzten tokiak. Norbait toki jakin batera joaten bada bertako historia eta kultura ezagutzeko helburuarekin, turismo kultural deritzo. Baliteke turistek herrialde jakin bateko leku ezagunak bisitatzea edo arreta zonalde bakarrean jartzea besterik gabe.
mt: The most common type of tourism is likely to be associated with the most people traveling: leisure tourism. People are going to a place very different from their everyday life, to rest and enjoy themselves. Beaches, theme parks and campgrounds are the places most visited by leisure tourists. If someone goes to a certain place to learn about the history and culture of that place, it is called cultural tourism. It is possible that tourists visit the famous places in a particular country or focus their attention on a single area.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Hainbat hamarkada tartean egon diren banakoek lagundu ziguten gure indarrak eta zaletasunak balioesten, zailtasunak eta porrotak ere prestutasunez ebaluatu bitartean. Bakoitzaren istorio indibidualak, familiarrak eta erakundekoak entzuten, erakundearen kulturan eragin positiboa edo negatiboa zuten nortasun batzuei eta iraganari buruzko informazio interesgarria lortu genuen. Baten istorioa ulertzeak halabeharrez kultura ulertzea ez den arren, erakundearen historiaren baitan non kokatzen diren jakiten laguntzen dio gutxienez jendeari. Arrakastak ebaluatzen eta porroten jakitun izaten, parte hartzaile guztiek modu sakonagoan ezagutzen dituzte erakundearen balioak, misioa eta indar higiarazleak. Egoera horretan, aurreko jarrera ekintzaileak eta haien arrakasta gogoratzeak jendeari lagundu zion aldaketa berriekiko eta herriko elizarekiko norabide berriarekiko alde agertzen. Arrakasten istorio horiek aldaketekiko beldurra gutxitu zuten, eta etorkizuneko aldaketarekiko joera positiboa sortu.
mt: 1. Over the past several decades, individual stories have helped us understand our organization's strengths and weaknesses, successes and failures. Stories about individuals, families, and organizations have provided us with interesting information about the character and history of the organization. Understanding the stories of others helps us understand the organization's history, even if we do not understand the culture. Evaluating successes and failures, and understanding the organization's values, mission, and strengths, helps us understand the organization's strengths, mission, and strengths. In this context, stories of past successes and their successes have helped us understand the organization's strengths, mission, and strengths. In this context, stories of past successes and their successes have helped us understand the organization's strengths, mission, and strengths. In this context, stories of past successes and their successes have helped us understand the organization's strengths, mission, and strengths. In this context, stories of past successes and their successes
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Ikasteari buruzko metodo postmodernoak askatasun absolutua eskaintzen du. Ez dago ikasteko modu egoki bakarrik. Izan ere, ez dago ikasteko gauza egoki bakarrik. Ikaslearen eta aurkeztutako ezagutzaren arteko esperientzian gertatzen da jakintza. Brikolajearen eta informazioaren aurkezpena bizi ditugu oraintsu, eta hori islatzen dute ikastean oinarritutako telebista-saioek. Gutako asko egoten gara telebistako programa bat ikusten, non hor azaltzen diguten prozesu edo esperientzian ez dugun inoiz parte hartuko edo ez dugun inoiz ezagutza hori praktikan jarriko. Ez dugu auto bat inoiz aztertuko, lorategian iturri bat eraikiko, antzinako hondakinak ikertzeko Perura bidaiatuko edo auzokidearen etxea birmoldatuko.
mt: Postmodern methods of learning offer absolute freedom. There is only one correct way to learn. There is only one correct thing to know. Knowledge is experienced between the learner and the presented knowledge. We live in the presentation of bricolage and information, and this is reflected in learning-based television shows. We often watch a television program where they present a process or experience in which we will never participate or never put that knowledge into practice. We will never examine a car, build a fountain in the garden, travel to Peru to excavate ancient ruins, or remodel a neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Loaren etenaldiaren prozesuan, loaldi arruntean berariaz esnatu eta handik gutxira loak hartzen zaitu berriro (10-60 minutu). Hori erraz lor daiteke kontziente egotea eragin baina guztiz esnatzen ez zaituen alarma apal bat erabilita. Lo zaudela erlojua berriz ezartzen baduzu, gelaren beste aldean jar dezakezu, itzaltzeko ohetik atera beharra izateko. Biorritmoetan oinarritutako aukeren artean lo egin aurretik likido ugari edatea da beste bat (batez ere ura edo tea edatea, diuretiko ezaguna baita), pixa egitera jaikitzera behartzeko.
mt: During a normal sleep cycle, you wake up intentionally and then fall asleep again (10-60 minutes). This can be easily accomplished by setting an alarm that is not loud enough to wake you up completely. If you set the alarm to go off again, you can get up from the bed, turn it off, and go back to sleep. Among the options based on biorhythms, drinking a lot of liquid before going to sleep is another one (especially drinking water or tea, which is known as a diuretic), to make you have to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Loaren etenaldiaren prozesuan, loaldi arruntean berariaz esnatu eta handik gutxira loak hartzen zaitu berriro (10-60 minutu). Hori erraz lor daiteke kontziente egotea eragin baina guztiz esnatzen ez zaituen alarma apal bat erabilita. src: Askok uste dute artifizialki induzitutako amets argiak maiz izatea oso neketsua izan daitekeela. Fenomeno horren arrazoi nagusia da amets argiek hedatu egiten dutela REM egoeren arteko denbora-tartea. REM tartean lo egiten dugu eta orduan du gorputzak berreskuratzeko aukera, eta gaueko halako tarte gutxiago izatea arazo bihur daiteke. Hogei edo hogeita hamar minuturo esnatu eta telebista ikusten jartzea bezain neketsua da. Zure garunak gaueko amets argiak izateko saiakera kopuruaren mende dago efektua.
mt: Many people believe that frequent lucid dreams can be very distressing. The main reason for this is that lucid dreams tend to extend the REM period. REM is the period during which we sleep and during which our bodies have the opportunity to recover, and having a shorter REM period can be a problem. Waking up every twenty or thirty minutes and turning on the TV can be very distressing. Your brain is under the influence of the number of attempts to have lucid dreams.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Talde birtualak ohiko taldeen bikaintasun estandar berberekin osatzen dira, baina desberdintasun txiki batzuk daude. Talde birtualetako kideek beren zuzeneko talde fisikoaren harreman-puntu gisa funtzionatzen dute. Ohiko taldeetako kideek baino autonomia handiagoa dute askotan, agian taldeak ordu-zona aldakorren arabera biltzen direlako, zeinak beren tokiko zuzendaritzak ulertzen ez dituen. Benetako “talde ikusezin” (Larson eta LaFasto, 1989, 109. or.) baten presentzia ere bada talde birtual baten osagai esklusiboa. Taldekide bakoitzak informatzen duen zuzendaritza taldea da “talde ikusezina”. Talde ikusezinak taldekide bakoitzaren estandarrak ezartzen ditu.
mt: Virtual teams are composed of individuals with the same standard of excellence as their traditional counterparts, but with some minor differences. Members of virtual teams function as the point of contact for their actual physical team. Members of traditional teams often have greater autonomy than their counterparts in virtual teams, perhaps because they are assembled in time zones that their local leadership does not understand. The presence of a “phantom team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, 109) is also exclusive to a virtual team. The “phantom team” is the leadership team that each individual reports to.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Edukien teorien xedea da pertsonak zerk markatzen dituen edo zerk erakartzen dituen jakitea. Teoria horiek iradokitzen dute jendeak behar eta/edo nahi jakin batzuk dituela eta helduarora iritsi ahala barneratu egiten dituztela. Teoria horiek bi ideiatan jartzen dute arreta: jendeak zergatik nahi dituen gauzak eta haien ingurunean dauden zer gauzek bultzatuko dituzten gauza jakinak egitera edo ez egitera. Maslowen beharren hierarkiaren teoria eta Hertzbergen bi faktoreen teoria dira edukien bi teoria ezagun.
mt: The goal of content theories is to understand what people want and/or need and how they come to acquire these things as they mature. These theories focus on two aspects of content: why people want certain things and what factors in their environment will motivate them to do or not do certain things. Maslow's hierarchy of needs and Herzberg's two-factor theory are two of the most well-known content theories.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Gehiegi erabili den eta maiz barregarri utzi den herenen araua irudi batean dinamismoa sortzeko eta, aldi berean, ordena apur bat gordetzeko gida sinple bat da. Arauak esaten duenez, subjektu nagusia kokatzeko tokirik eraginkorrenak irudia bertikalean eta horizontalean herenetan zatitzen duten lerroak gurutzatzen diren puntuak dira (ikusi adibidea).
mt: A simple guide to creating dynamism in a picture by overusing and often discarding the rule of thirds is to place the main subject at the points where the lines dividing the picture into thirds horizontally and vertically intersect (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Adibidez, irudi finkoen argazkilaritzan 35 mm-ko formatua da munduan ohikoena, film-tamaina hori baitzen nagusi film analogoen garaiaren amaieran. Gaur egun ere ekoizten da, baina, are garrantzitsuago dena, haren proportzioarekin jarraitu dute kamera digitaletako irudi-sentsoreen formatuek. Izan ere, nahasgarria bada ere, 35 mm-ko formatuak 36 mm-ko zabalera eta 24 mm-ko altuera du. Formatu honen proportzioa (hamabirekin zatitzen da zenbaki osodun proportzio sinpleena lortzeko), horrenbestez, 3:2 dela esaten da. Formatu arrunt askok (APS formatu-familiak, adibidez) proportzio horren berdina edo ingurukoa dute.
mt: 35 mm is the most common format in the world for still photography, as it was the most common film size at the end of the analog film era. It is still produced, but more importantly, its proportions have been followed by the formats of digital camera image sensors. Confusingly, the 35 mm format has a width of 36 mm and a height of 24 mm. Its proportions, therefore, are 3:2, which is the simplest ratio of a number divisible by two (3:2 is the ratio of 6:4). Many common formats (APS family formats, for example) have proportions very close to or equal to this.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Zoom lenteen desabantaila da foku-distantzia sorta lortzeko foku-konplexutasun eta lente-elementu askoz gehiago behar direla lente primarioekin baino. Arazo hori txikiagotzen ari da, lente-ekoizleak lenteen ekoizpenean estandar hobeak lortzen ari baitira. Horri esker, foku-distantzia finkoa duten lenteekin lortzen den kalitatearen pareko irudiak sortzeko aukera dago zoom lenteekin. Zoom lenteen beste desabantaila bat da lentearen irekidura maximoa (abiadura) baxuagoa izan ohi dela. Horren ondorioz, zoom lente merkeak erabiltzeko zailagoak dira argi gutxiko kondiziotan flashik ez dagoenean.
mt: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that it is more difficult to achieve a focus range with more complex focus and more lens elements than with prime lenses. This problem is being reduced, as lens manufacturers are achieving better standards in lens production. As a result, it is possible to get images of the same quality as with fixed-focus lenses with zoom lenses. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (speed) is usually lower. As a result, zoom lenses are more difficult to use in low light conditions without a flash.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Mistizismoaren helburua da errealitate, dibinitate, egia espiritual edo jainkoaren kontzientzia kontzientea izatea edo harekin bat egitea edo identifikatzea. Errealitate jainkotiarrarekin/jainkoarekin edo jainkoekin esperientzia, intuizio edo pertzepzio zuzena izan nahi du sinestunak. Jarraitzaileek esperientzia horiek elikatzeko balio duten bizimodu edo jarduera jakinak egiten dituzte. Mistizismoa beste erlijio-sinesmen eta gurtza-formetatik bereizten da, kontzientzia-egoera bereziaren esperientzia pertsonal zuzenean jartzen duelako garrantzia, batez ere, esperientzia baketsu, sakon, zoriontsu eta euforikoetan.
mt: The goal of mysticism is to become conscious of or to identify with or to merge with the divine reality, God, or the gods. Mystics seek direct experience, intuition, or perception of this reality. They engage in particular behaviors or activities to nourish these experiences. Mysticism is distinguished from other religious beliefs and practices by the importance placed on direct personal experience, especially in ecstatic, profound, blissful, and euphoric experiences.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Denbora luzez, hemeretzigarren eta hogeigarren mendeetan, uste zen Zeelanda Berriko lehen biztanleak Maori herria izan zirela, moa deritzen hegazti erraldoiak ehizatzen zituztenak. Teoriaren arabera, Maori jendea Polinesiatik joan zen flota handi batean eta Zeelanda Berria kendu zieten Morioriei, eta nekazal gizartea ezarri zuten. Hala ere, frogek iradokitzen dute Morioriak Maori kontinentalen talde bat zirela, Zeelanda Berritik Chatham uharteetara migratu, eta beren kultura baketsu adierazgarria garatu zutenak. Beste tribu bat zegoen Chatham uharteetan, Zeelanda Berritik alde egin zuten Maoriak, alegia. Moriori deitzen zieten beren buruei, borroka txiki batzuk egon ziren, eta, azkenean, Morioriak suntsitu zituzten.
mt: For a long time, it was believed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted the moa, giant birds. The theory was that the Maori people came from Polynesia in a large fleet, and took over New Zealand from the Moriori people, and established an agricultural society. However, evidence suggests that the Moriori were a subgroup of the continental Maori, who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, and developed their own peaceful culture. Another tribe was on the Chatham Islands, who were called the Moriori, and there were some small skirmishes, and eventually the Moriori were destroyed.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: Pureland origamiaren kasuan, bakoitzean toles bakarra egin daiteke, ezin dira atzeranzko tolesak eta bestelako toles konplexuak egin, eta toles guztiek kokapen garbiak izan behar dituzte. 1970eko hamarkadan garatu zuen John Smith-ek, esperientziarik ez duten tolestaileei edo trebetasun motor mugatuak dituztenei laguntzeko.
mt: In pureland origami, only one fold can be made at a time, no back folds or other complex folds can be made, and all folds must be in the correct position. It was developed in the 1970s by John Smith, to help those with no experience or limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Indus haraneko zibilizazioa Brontze aroko zibilizazio bat zen, Indiako azpikontinenteko ipar-mendebaldean zegoen, eta egungo Pakistanen zati handiena, Indiako ipar-mendebaldeko eskualde batzuk eta Afganistango ipar-ekialdea hartzen zituen. Zibilizazioa Indus ibaiaren arroetan garatu zen, eta hortik eratortzen da haren izena. Aditu batzuen esanean, gaur egun lehortuta dagoen Sarasvati ibaiaren arroetan ere egon zen zibilizazio hori eta, hori dela eta, Indus-Sarasvati zibilizazioa izendatu beharko litzateke. Beste batzuek Harappa-ko zibilizazioa deitzen diote, 1920ko hamarkadan induskatutako lehen gunea izan baitzen Harappa.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization that flourished in the northwestern region of the Indian subcontinent, in contemporary Pakistan and northwestern India. The Indus Valley Civilization was one of the largest early urban civilizations, along with Ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia. It is also called the Harappan Civilization after the type site, Harappa, the first of its sites to be recognized and explored, in the 1920s. The Indus Valley Civilization is also known as the Indus Civilization, the Harappan Civilization, the Harappan Culture, the Harappa Culture, the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, and the Indus-Sarasvati Culture.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Indus haraneko zibilizazioa Brontze aroko zibilizazio bat zen, Indiako azpikontinenteko ipar-mendebaldean zegoen, eta egungo Pakistanen zati handiena, Indiako ipar-mendebaldeko eskualde batzuk eta Afganistango ipar-ekialdea hartzen zituen. Zibilizazioa Indus ibaiaren arroetan garatu zen, eta hortik eratortzen da haren izena. Aditu batzuen esanean, gaur egun lehortuta dagoen Sarasvati ibaiaren arroetan ere egon zen zibilizazio hori eta, hori dela eta, Indus-Sarasvati zibilizazioa izendatu beharko litzateke. Beste batzuek Harappa-ko zibilizazioa deitzen diote, 1920ko hamarkadan induskatutako lehen gunea izan baitzen Harappa.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization that flourished in the northwestern region of the Indian subcontinent, in contemporary Pakistan and northwestern India. The Indus Valley Civilization was one of the largest early urban civilizations, along with Ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia. It is also called the Harappan Civilization after the type site, Harappa, the first of its sites to be recognized and explored, in the 1920s. The Indus Valley Civilization is also known as the Indus Civilization, the Harappan Civilization, the Harappan Culture, the Harappa Culture, the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, and the Indus-Sarasvati Culture.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Diruzalekeria eta norberekeria gurekin egongo dira beti, eta elkarlanaren funtsa da gehienentzako onura dagoenean beti egongo dela epe laburrean gehiago irabazteko aukera, berekoikeriaz jardunda. Zorte pixka batekin, jende gehiena ohartuko da epe luzerako aukera onena besteekin batera lan egitea dela.
mt: 1. Selfishness and greed will always be with us, and the basis of cooperation is that when it is in our interest to cooperate, we will do so in order to have the opportunity to gain more in the short term. With a little luck, most people will realize that the best long-term opportunity is to work together.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Filipinak konkistatzeko lanetan AEBetako inperialismoak izan zituen gerra-gastuak filipinarrek eurek ordaindu zituzten. AEBetako erregimen kolonialari zergak ordaintzera behartu zituzten gastuen zati handi bat eta Filipinetako gobernuaren izenean Wall Street-eko banketxeen bidez igorritako bonuen interesak ordaintzeko. Nola ez, filipinarren esplotazio luzetik eratorritako irabaziak izan ziren AEBetako inperialismoaren oinarrizko irabaziak.
mt: The costs of the Philippine conquest by American imperialism were borne by the Filipinos. A large part of the costs were paid by taxes imposed on the colonial regime by the Filipinos and the interest on bonds issued by Wall Street banks in the name of the Philippine government. How else, the profits from the exploitation of the Filipinos were the basic profits of American imperialism.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Tenplarioak ulertzeko, ordena sortzea eragin zuen testuingurua ulertu behar da. Gertakari horien garaiari Europako historiako Erdi Aro Klasikoa deritzo, eta 11., 12. eta 13. mendeak (K.O. 1000-1300 urteak) hartzen ditu. Erdi Aro Klasikoaren aurretik Goi Erdi Aroa egon zen, eta haren ondoren, berriz, Behe Erdi Aroa, zeina 1500. urtearen inguruan amaitzen baita konbentzioz.
mt: To understand the temples, one must understand the context in which they were built. This period is known as the Classical Middle Ages, and covers the 11th, 12th and 13th centuries (K.O. 1000-1300). Before the Classical Middle Ages was the High Middle Ages, and after it was the Late Middle Ages, which ended around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Erromatar inperioaren izaera militarrari esker, aurrerapen mediko asko egon ziren. Augusto enperadoreak doktoreak errekrutatu zituen; are gehiago, erromatarren lehen gorputz medikoa eratu zuen borroken ondoren erabiltzeko. Kirurgialariek hainbat lasaigarri ezagutzen zituzten, besteak beste, mitxoleta hazien erauzkinetatik lortutako morfina eta erabelarraren hazietatik lortutako eskopolamina. Pazienteak gangrena izatetik salbatzeko anputazioak egiten iaioak bihurtu ziren, baita odol-jarioa eteteko torniketeak eta arterietarako bridak erabiltzen ere. Hainbat mendetan, Erromatar inperioak aurrerakuntza handiak egin zituen medikuntzan eta gaur dugun jakintzaren gehiengoa osatu zuen.
mt: The military nature of the Roman Empire led to many medical advances. Emperor Augustus recruited doctors; moreover, he established the first Roman medical corps for use after battles. Surgeons learned to use morphine, extracted from poppy seedpods, and scopolamine, extracted from henbane seeds. They became adept at amputating limbs to save patients from gangrene, and using tourniquets and artery clamps to stop bleeding. For many centuries, the Roman Empire made great advances in medicine and laid the foundation for much of what we know today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Ikusmenak edo ikusteko gaitasunak ikusmen-sistemaren zentzumen-organoak edo begiak behar ditu. Begiek hainbat egitura dituzte, organismoaren beharren arabera konplexutasun-maila bat edo beste dutenak. Egitura bakoitzak gaitasun bat dauka, uhin-luzera desberdinekiko sentikortasuna dute eta zorroztasun-maila desberdinak dituzte. Halaber, askotariko prozesuak behar dituzte sarrerako informazioari eta hainbat zenbakiri zentzua emateko eta modu onenean funtzionatzeko.
mt: Vision or the ability to see requires the visual system's sensory organs or eyes. The eyes have several structures, each with a function, complexity level, and sensitivity to different wavelengths of light. They also require various processes to interpret incoming information and assign meaning to it in a useful way.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: Sikhismoa Indiako azpikontinenteko erlijioa da. Punjab eskualdean sortu zen 15. mendean, Hindu tradizioaren barruan gertatu zen banaketa sektario baten ondorioz. Sikh-ek haien erlijioa hinduismotik bereizitzat hartzen dute, nahiz eta haren sustrai eta tradizio hinduak onartzen dituzten. Sikh-ek haren erlijioari Gurmat deritze; punjabieraz “guruaren bidea” esan nahi du. Gurua Indiako erlijio guztien oinarrizko alderdi bat da, baina sikhismoan garrantzia handia du eta sikh sinesmenen muina osatzen du. Erlijioa 15. mendean sortu zuen Guru Nanak-ek (1469-1539). Haren ondoren beste bederatzi guru egon ziren.
mt: Sikhism is a religion of the Indian subcontinent. It was founded in the 15th century in the Punjab region by Guru Nanak (1469-1539). After him there were nine more gurus. Sikhism is distinct from Hinduism, though it has roots and traditions in Hinduism. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat; in Punjabi, it means "the way of the guru". The guru is a basic element of all Indian religions, but in Sikhism it has great importance and forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded by Guru Nanak (1469-1539). After him there were nine more gurus.
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: Arreta-defizitaren nahasmendua “sindrome neurologiko bat da, eta definitzen duten sintomen hirukote klasikoa, oldarkortasuna, distraitzeko erraztasuna eta hiperaktibitatea edo gehiegizko energia dira”. Ez da ikasketa-desgaitasuna, ikasketa-nahasmendua baizik. “Haurren ehuneko 3-5ek dute, eta, beraz, 2 milioi haur amerikarri eragiten die”. AFN duten haurrei asko kostatzen zaie eskolako lanetan arreta jartzea, baina erraz kontzentra daitezke gozatzen duten jardueretan, adibidez, jokoak jolasten, marrazki bizidun gogokoak ikusten edo puntuaziorik gabeko esaldiak idazten. Haur horiek arazo ugari izaten dituzte garuna estimulatzeko “jarduera arriskutsuak egiten dituztelako, borroka egiten dutelako eta autoritateari kontra egiten diotelako”, ezin baitute garuna metodo arrunten bidez estimulatu. AFNk haurrek parekoekin dituzten harremanei eragiten die, beste haurrek ezin baitute ulertu zergatik jarduten diren modu horretan, edo zergatik idazten dituzten letrak modu horretan edo zergatik den haien heldutasun-maila ezberdina.
mt: Attention Deficit Disorder is “a neurological syndrome defined by the classic triad of inattention, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excessive energy.” It is not learning disability, but learning disorder. “It affects 3-5 percent of children, or 2 million American children.” It costs schools a lot to pay attention to these children, but they can easily concentrate on activities they enjoy, such as playing games, watching cartoons, or writing sentences without punctuation. These children have many problems because they stimulate their brains with “dangerous activities, fighting, and defying authority,” as they cannot stimulate their brains in the usual way. ADHD affects the relationships children have with peers, as other children cannot understand why they behave in this way, or why they write letters in this way, or why their level of maturity is different.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Proiektuetan oinarritutako ikasketak ikasteko prozesua errazagoa eta interesgarriagoa bihurtzen badu ere, aldamio-metodoak beste urrats bat egiten du aurrera. Aldamio-metodoa ez da ikasteko metodo bat, baizik eta ikasketa-esperientzia berri baten murgilduta daudenei laguntzeko modu bat, adibidez, ordenagailu-programa berri bat erabiltzean edo proiektu berri bat hastean beharrezkoa dena. Aldamioak birtualak edo benetakoak izan daitezke; bestela esanda, irakasle bat aldamio mota bat da, baita Microsoft Office-ko klip-gizontxoa ere. Aldamio birtualak softwarean txertatzen dira, eta ikasleak bakarrik kudeatzeko zailak izan daitezkeen prozeduren inguruko galderak, oharrak eta azalpenak ematen dituzte.
mt: While project-based learning may make the process of learning easier and more interesting, the peer method takes another step forward. Peer methods are not learning methods, but rather a way to help those immersed in a new learning experience, such as using a new computer program or starting a new project. Peers can be virtual or real; in other words, a teacher is a type of peer, as is the clipart in Microsoft Office. Virtual peers are embedded in software, and can provide questions, comments, and explanations about procedures that may be difficult for students to manage on their own.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: Estatu Batuetan, webgune ezagunenen artean hirugarrena da MySpace, eta 54 milioi profil ditu gaur egun. Horrelako webguneek arreta handia piztu dute, batez ere hezkuntzaren alorrean. Horrelako webguneek hainbat abantaila dituzte: esaterako, erraza da eskolan erabiltzeko orrialde bat prestatzea, eta orrialde horretan bildu daitezke blogak, bideoak, argazkiak eta beste hainbat baliabide. Oso erraza da orrialde horretan sartzea, web helbide bat besterik ez baita behar; horrek erraztu egiten du ikasleek gogoratzea, eta, beraz, errazagoa izango da teklatua erabiltzearekin edo ortografiarekin zailtasunak dituzten ikasleentzat ere. Egokitu egin daiteke, irakurtzeko erraza izan dadin, eta nahi adina kolore jar dakioke, norbere nahiaren arabera.
mt: In the United States, MySpace is the third most popular website, with 54 million profiles today. Such websites have attracted a lot of attention, especially in the field of education. Such websites have many advantages: for example, it is easy to prepare a page for school, and on that page you can collect blogs, videos, photos and other resources. It is very easy to add to that page, only a web address is needed; this makes it easier for students to remember, and thus it will be easier for students who have difficulties with the keyboard or spelling. It can be adapted to be easy to read, and any color can be added, as desired.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: Hala ere, 1956ko ekainean, Krushev-ek egindako promesak probatu egin ziren; Polonian elikagai-gabeziaren eta soldaten jaitsieraren kontrako langileen protesta komunismoaren aurkako protesta orokor bihurtu ziren. Azkenean, Krushev-ek bakea berreskuratzeko tankeak bidali behar izan bazituen ere, eskaera ekonomiko batzuk onartu eta Wladyslaw Gomulka popularra jarri zuen lehen ministro berri gisa.
mt: However, in June 1956, Kruschev's promises were tested; the Polish workers' protest against food shortages and the reduction of the army became a general protest against communism.  In the end, Kruschev had to send tanks to restore peace, but he also accepted some economic demands and put Wladyslaw Gomulka in place as the new popular prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Alemania askoren etsaia zen II. Mundu Gerran, eta horrek SESB eta AEBen arteko lankidetza ekarri zuen. Gerra amaitzean, sisteman, prozesuetan eta kulturan zeuden talken ondorioz, herrialdeak elkarrengandik aldendu egin ziren. Gerra amaitu eta bi urtera, aliatu izandakoak etsai bihurtu ziren eta Gerra Hotza hasi zen. Hurrengo 40 urteak iraun zituen gerrak, eta benetako borrokaldiak egon ziren, armada ordezkarien bidez, Afrikatik Asiara, Afganistanen, Kuban eta beste hainbat tokitan.
mt: Germany was the enemy of many during World War II, and this led to cooperation between the Soviet Union and the United States. After the war, disagreements over the system, process, and culture led the countries to drift apart. Two years after the war, former allies became enemies and the Cold War began. The next 40 years were spent in war, with proxy armies fighting in Africa, Asia, Afghanistan, Cuba, and other places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Nerbio-sistemak homeostasia mantentzen du nerbio-bulkadak gorputzera bidaliz, odolaren zirkulazioa bermatzeko eta odolaren banaketa homogeneoa izateko. Nerbio-bulkada horiek oso azkar bidal daitezke gorputzean zehar eta, horri esker, mehatxu posibleetatik babestuta dago gorputza.
mt: The nervous system maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses to the body, to ensure proper circulation and a homogeneous distribution of blood. These nerve impulses can be sent quickly throughout the body, and thus protect the body from possible threats.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: Giza-ko Piramide Handia da gaur egun bere horretan dirauen antzinako zazpi mirarietatik bakarra. Egiptoarrek O.A.A. hirugarren mendean eraiki zuten Piramide Handia, hildako faraoiaren ohorez eraikitako piramide-egitura handietako bat. Egiptoko Heriotzaren haranean dagoen Giza-ko lautadak edo “Giza-ko Nekropoliak” hainbat piramide, hilobi txiki, tenplu ditu, baita Esfinge handia ere (eta piramide handia guztietan handiena da). Khufu faraoiaren ohorez eraiki zen piramide handia, eta piramide txikiagoak zein hilobi eta tenplu asko Khufu-ren emazteen eta familiako kideen ohorez eraiki ziren.
mt: The Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the seven wonders of the ancient world. The Egyptians built the Great Pyramid in the third century BC, as a pyramid structure built in honor of a dead pharaoh. The Giza plateau or "Giza Necropolis" has many pyramids, small tombs, temples, and the Great Sphinx (and it is the largest of all pyramids). The Great Pyramid was built in honor of pharaoh Khufu, and smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built in honor of Khufu's wives and family members.
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Efeso-n zegoen Artemis-en tenplua O.A.A. 356ko uztailaren 21ean suntsitu zen Herostratus-ek su emanda. Historiak dioenaren arabera, kosta ahala kosta famatu izatea zen haren helburua. Efesoarrek, haserre, iragarri zuten Herostratus-en izena ez zela inoiz erregistratuko. Estrabon historialari greziarrak jaso zuen izena, eta hala ezagutzen dugu orain. Alexandro Handia jaio zen gau berean suntsitu zen tenplua. Alexandro-k, errege zela, tenplua berreraikitzeko beharrezko dirua ordaintzea eskaini zuen, baina atzera bota zuten eskaintza. Beranduago, Alexandro hil ondoren berreraiki zen tenplua O.A.A. 323an.
mt: 21 July 356 CE, the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was destroyed by fire set by Herostratus. According to history, his goal was to become famous. The Ephesians, angry, declared that the name of Herostratus would never be recorded. The name was recorded by the Greek historian Strabo, and so we know it today. Alexander the Great was born on the same night the temple was destroyed. Alexander, as king, offered to pay the necessary money to rebuild the temple, but the offer was rejected. Later, after Alexander's death, the temple was rebuilt in 323 CE.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Ezagutzen den lehen garraioa oinez ibiltzea da; izan ere, duela bi milioi urte hasi ziren gizakiak zutik ibiltzen, Homo Erectusaren agerraldiarekin (zutikako gizaki esan nahi duena). Haien aitzineko australopitekoak ez ziren eskuarki zutik ibiltzen. Espezializazio bipedoak aurkitu dira duela 4,2-3,9 milioi urteko australopitekoen fosiletan, baina baliteke Sahelanthropusak ere bi oinetan ibili izana duela zazpi milioi urte.
mt: The first known form of transportation was walking on two feet; humans began walking upright about two million years ago with the appearance of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their earlier australopithecines were not always bipedal. Bipedalization has been found in the fossil remains of 4.2-3.9 million year old australopithecines, but it is possible that Sahelanthropus also walked on two feet seven million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Merkantziak garraiatzeko itsasontziak erabiltzea da ozeanoetan zehar jende eta merkantzia kantitate handiak mugitzeko modurik eraginkorrena. Marinen lan tradizionala izan da herrialdeek jendea eta merkantziak mugitzeko duten gaitasunari eustea, eta, aldi berean, etsaiek jendea eta merkantziak mugitzeko duten gaitasuna oztopatzea. Horren adibiderik nabarmenena II. Mundu Gerrako Ipar Atlantikoko kanpaina izan zen. Amerikarrak gizonak eta materialak bidali nahian ari ziren, Ozeano Atlantikoa zeharkatuz, Britainiari laguntzeko. Era berean, Alemaniako itsas-armadak U-ontziak erabili zituen trafiko hori geldiarazteko. Aliatuek porrot egin balute, Britainia Handia konkistatzeko gai izan zatekeen Alemania, Europako gainerako herrialdeekin egin zuen bezala.
mt: Merchant ships are the most efficient means of transporting large numbers of people and goods across oceans. The traditional role of navies has been to ensure the ability of their own country to transport people and goods, and to prevent other countries from doing so. The most notable example of this is the Battle of the Atlantic during World War II. The Allies were trying to transport men and material across the Atlantic to aid Britain, while the German navy used U-boats to disrupt this traffic. If the Allies had failed, Germany would have been able to conquer Britain, as it did with the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Erradiodun gurpilak asmatzeari esker, asiriarren gurdiak arinagoak, azkarragoak eta soldaduak eta bestelako gurdiak gainditzeko hobeto prestatuak ziren. Haien arku hilgarriekin jaurtitako geziek kontrako soldaduen armadura zeharkatzen zuten. K.A. 1000. urtean, asiriarrek lehen zalditeria erabili zuten. Zaldien gainean borrokatzen duen armada bat da zalditeria. Zela asmatu gabe zegoen oraindik, eta, beraz, asiriarrek zaldien bizkarren gainean eserita borrokatzen zuten.
mt: 1000 BC, the Assyrians invented the spoked wheel, which made chariots faster, lighter, and better able to carry soldiers and other equipment. Their bows could pierce the armor of opposing soldiers. The first cavalry was used by the Assyrians in 1000 BC. Cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The horse was not yet domesticated, so the Assyrians fought on the backs of horses.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Babiloniarrek tenplu primario bat eraiki zioten jainko bakoitzari, eta hori hartzen zuten jainkoaren etxetzat. Jendeak sakrifizioak ekartzen zizkion jainkoari, eta apaizak jainkoen beharrei erantzuten saiatzen ziren zeremoniak eta jaialdiak eginez. Tenplu bakoitzak patio ireki bat zuen, baita barneko santutegi bat ere, apaizek soilik erabil zezaketena. Zenbaitetan zigurat izeneko piramide-formako dorreak eraikitzen zituzten tenpluaren osagai gisa. Dorrearen goiko aldea jainkoarentzat santutegi berezia zen.
mt: Babylonians built a primary temple for each god, and that was taken as the god's house. People brought sacrifices to the god, and priests tried to answer the god's needs by holding ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open courtyard, as well as an inner sanctuary, which could only be used by priests. Some had ziggurats, pyramid-shaped towers, built as part of the temple. The upper part of the tower was a special sanctuary for the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: Bai! Tutankamon erregea, batzuetan “Tut erregea” edo “mutiko erregea” izenez ezagutzen dena, garai modernoetan gehien ezagutzen den antzinako Egiptoko erregea da. Interesgarria da jakitea antzinako garaietan ez zela garrantzitsutzat jotzen eta ez zegoela erregistratuta antzinako erregeen zerrenda gehienetan. Hala ere, 1922an haren hilobia aurkitzeak famatu egin zuen. Iraganeko hilobi asko lapurtu egin zituzten arren, hilobi hau ukitu gabe utzi zen. Tutankamon-ekin batera hilobiratutako elementu gehienak ere ondo kontserbatu ziren, metal preziatuz eta harri bakanez egindako milaka artefaktu barne.
mt: Yes! Tutankhamun, sometimes known as "Tut king" or "child king", is the most famous ancient Egyptian king of modern times. It is interesting to know that he was not considered important and was not registered in most lists of ancient kings. However, his tomb was discovered in 1922, making him famous. Most ancient tombs were looted, but this one was left untouched. Most of the artifacts buried with Tutankhamun were also well preserved, including thousands of artifacts made of precious metal and stone.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Bai! Tutankamon erregea, batzuetan “Tut erregea” edo “mutiko erregea” izenez ezagutzen dena, garai modernoetan gehien ezagutzen den antzinako Egiptoko erregea da. mt: Yes! Tutankhamun, sometimes known as "Tut king" or "child king", is the most famous ancient Egyptian king of modern times. It is interesting to know that he was not considered important and was not registered in most lists of ancient kings. However, his tomb was discovered in 1922, making him famous. Most ancient tombs were looted, but this one was left untouched. Most of the artifacts buried with Tutankhamun were also well preserved, including thousands of artifacts made of precious metal and stone.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Greziako politikari, zientzialari eta artista ugari ezagutzen ditugu. Ziurrenez, kultura horretako pertsonarik ezagunena Homero da, legendazko poeta itsua, greziar literaturako bi maisulan osatu zituena: Iliada eta Odisea poemak. Sofokles eta Aristofanes ere antzerkigile famatuak dira oraindik ere, eta haien antzerkiak literaturaren munduko lan handienen artean daude. Greziako beste pertsona famatu bat Pitagoras matematikaria da. Triangeluen alboen arteko harremanari buruzko teorema famatuagatik da ezaguna, batez ere.
mt: We know many politicians, scientists and artists from Greece. Homer, the blind poet of legend, is probably the most famous person from that culture, having composed two of the greatest works of Greek literature: the epic poems Iliad and Odyssey. The playwrights Sophocles and Aristophanes are also well known, and their plays are among the greatest works of literature. Another famous person from Greece is the mathematician Pythagoras, known for his famous theorem about the relationship of the sides of a triangle, especially.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: Ekialde Hurbileko klima epelean, etxea ez zen hain garrantzitsua. Familia hebrearraren bizitzaren zatirik handiena aire zabalean gertatzen zen. Emakumeek patioan prestatzen zuten janaria; dendak kalera begira zeuden erakusmahai irekiak ziren. Harria erabiltzen zuten etxeak eraikitzeko. Ez zegoen baso handirik Kanaan-eko lurretan, eta, beraz, zura oso garestia zen.
mt: In the Middle East climate, the house was not so important. Most of the family's life took place outdoors. Women prepared food in the courtyard; shops were open to the street with open display cases. Stone was used to build houses. There was no large forest in the land of Canaan, and so wood was very expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
