src: Groenlandian ez da herri askorik egon. Saga eskandinaviarretan aipatzen da Erik Gorria Islandiatik erbesteratu egin zutela erailketa batengatik, eta mendebalderago bidaiatzean Groenlandia aurkitu eta Groenlandia izena jarri ziola. Haren aurkikuntza gorabehera, tribu eskimalak dagoeneko han bizi ziren. Herrialde horietako bakoitza “eskandinaviarra” bazen ere, ezberdintasun ugari zeuden Danimarka, Suedia, Norvegia eta Islandiako jendearen, erregeen, ohituren eta historiaren artean.
mt: There were not many towns in Greenland.  Erik the Red is mentioned as having been exiled from Iceland for a killing, and on his journey westward he found Greenland and named it Greenland.  His discovery was a matter of chance, as Eskimo tribes were already living there.  Each of these countries was "Scandinavian" but there were many differences between the customs, kings, and histories of the people of Denmark, Sweden, Norway, and Iceland.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Erromatarren janari gehienak guretzat ezagunak badira ere, bazituzten banketeetarako plater arraro edo ezohikoak ere, besteak beste, basurde basatia, hegazterrena, barraskiloak edo muxarra izeneko karraskaria. Beste ezberdintasun bat zen pertsona txiroek eta emakumeek janaria eserita jaten zutela eta gizon aberatsek oturuntzak elkarrekin jaten zituztela albo batera etzanda. Antzinako erromatarrek ezin izan zituzten jan mende batzuk beranduago Amerikatik edo Asiatik Europara etorri ziren janariak. Adibidez, ez zuten artorik, ezta tomaterik, patatarik edo kakaorik ere, eta antzinako erromatarrek ez zuten indioilarra dastatu.
mt: While many of the foods of the Romans are familiar to us, they also had rare or unusual dishes for banquets, such as wild boar, bird's nest, dormice or the "murex" (a type of sea snail). Another difference was that the poor and women ate sitting down, while the rich and men ate reclining on couches. The ancient Romans could not have tasted many foods that would not arrive in Europe from the Americas or Asia for centuries. For example, they did not have artichokes, tomatoes, potatoes or chocolate, and the ancient Romans did not eat corn.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Zibilizazio esaten zaio elkarrekin bizi eta era kooperatiboan, gizarte baten gisan, lan egiten duen pertsona talde esanguratsu batek partekatzen duen kultura berezi bati. Zibilizazio hitza latineko civilis hitzetik dator. Horrek zibil esan nahi du eta latineko civis hitzarekin, hiritar esan nahi duenarekin, eta civitas hitzarekin, hiri edo hiri estatu esan nahi duenarekin, erlazionatuta dago, eta, aldi berean, gizarte baten tamaina definitzen du nolabait. Hiri-estatuak nazioen aitzindariak dira. Zibilizazioa duen kultura batek esan nahi du ezagutza hainbat belaunalditan zehar igarotzen dela, aztarna kultural bat dagoela eta bidezko hedakuntza egiten dela. Maila txikiagoko kulturak ebidentzia historiko nabarmenik utzi gabe desagertzen dira eta ez dira zibilizazio gisa aintzatesten.
mt: A civilization is a relatively large-scale, complex, and enduring society that is characterized by symbolic culture, the domestication of certain plants and animals (agriculture), cities, specialized craftsmanship, and a form of government other than a tribe. Civilizations have existed for thousands of years across multiple continents. The English word "civilization" and the concept in the 19th century were nationalistic, but in the 20th century, they became more global in perspective. The term "civilization" shares the same Latin root, namely " civis " meaning "city" or "social order", from which "civil" as well as "civilized" is derived. The related term "civilized", dating to the 16th century, means "bringing together individuals into a group that shares common rules and laws to exercise government", and "residing or living in a city". The term "civilization" may also refer to the material culture of a society, and to the stage of human social development defined by a particular culture's urban development, specializations, and government. The term "civilization" shares the same Latin root, namely " civis " meaning "city" or "social order", from which "civil" as well as "civilized" is derived. The related term "civilized", dating to the 16th century, means "bringing together individuals into a group that shares common rules and laws to exercise government", and "residing or living in a city". The term "civilization" may also refer to the material culture of a society, and to the stage of human social development defined by a particular culture's urban development, specializations, and government.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong hondatutako gotorleku eta monasterio budista bat da eta Paro distrituko goiko aldean dago (Phondey herrian). Esaten denez, 1649an, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel-ek gotorlekua sortu zuen Tibet eta Mongoliako armaden kontra lortutako garaipena gogoratzeko. 1951n, sute baten eraginez Drukgyal Dzong-eko erlikia gutxi batzuk kontserbatu ziren, horien artean, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal-en irudia. Sutearen ondoren, gotorlekua gorde eta zaindu egin zuten, eta Bhutan-go atrakzio paregabeenetako bat da orain ere.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper Paro district (in Phondey village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel built the fortress to commemorate his victory over the Tibetan and Mongolian armies. In 1951, a fire destroyed some of the relics of Drukgyal Dzong, including a statue of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, and is now one of the most remarkable attractions in Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: 18. mendean, Kanbodiak bi bizilagun boteretsuren artean aurkitu zuen bere burua: Thailandia-k eta Vietnam-ek inguratzen zuten. Thai-ek Kanbodia hainbat aldiz inbaditu zuten 18. mendean, eta 1772an Phnom Phen suntsitu zuten. 18. mendeko azken urteetan, vietnamdarrek ere inbaditu zuten Kanbodia.
mt: 18th century, Cambodia found itself between two powerful neighbors: Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century, and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century, the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Taiwan-en hasiera 15. mendean kokatzen da, Europako marinelak handik igarotzean Ilha Formosa, uharte ederra, izena eman ziotenean. 1624an, Herbehereetako Ekialdeko Indiako Konpainia Taiwan hego-mendebaldean finkatu zen, eta jatorrizko biztanleek laboreak ekoizteko zituzten jarduerak eraldatzen hasi ziren, baita Txina-ko langileak hango arroz- eta azukre-landaketetan lan egiteko erabiltzen hasi ere. 1683an, Qing dinastiaren (1644-1912) armadak Taiwan-en mendebaldeko eta iparraldeko kostako eremuak hartu zituen, eta Qing inperioaren probintzia izendatu zuten Taiwan 1885ean. 1895ean, Lehen Txina-Japonia gerran (1894-1895), Qing gobernuak Shimonoseki-ko hitzarmena sinatu zuen, eta hitzartutakoaren arabera, Taiwan Japoniari eman zion, zeinek uhartean aginduko baitzuen 1945 arte.
mt: Taiwan is generally dated to the 15th century, when European sailors passed by and named the island Ilha Formosa, meaning "beautiful island". In 1624, the Dutch East India Company settled in southwestern Taiwan, and the indigenous people began to change their agricultural practices to accommodate the Dutch, who also began to use Chinese laborers in the island's rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, the Qing army took control of the western and northern coastal regions of Taiwan, and Taiwan was designated as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, during the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, and ceded Taiwan to Japan, who would rule the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Horri konposatu kimiko baten pH-a deritzo. Adierazle bat egin dezakezu aza gorriaren ura erabilita. Azaren ura kolorez aldatzen da konposatu kimikoaren azidotasunaren edo basikotasunaren (alkalinotasunaren) arabera. Probarako erabilitako konposatu kimikoan zenbat hidrogeno ioi (pH-ren H-a) dauden adierazten du pH mailak. Hidrogeno ioiak elektroiak erauzita dituzten protoiak dira (izan ere, protoi batek eta ioi batek osatzen dute hidrogeno atomoa).
mt: The pH of a solution is the measure of the concentration of hydrogen ions in the solution. The pH scale ranges from 0 to 14, with 7 being neutral. A pH below 7 is acidic, and a pH above 7 is basic. The pH of a solution can be determined by using a pH indicator, such as red cabbage juice. The color of the red cabbage juice changes depending on the acidity or basicity of the solution. The pH of the solution is determined by the amount of hydrogen ions (the H in pH) present. Hydrogen ions are protons that have lost their electrons (since a proton and an ion together make up a hydrogen atom).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Horri konposatu kimiko baten pH-a deritzo. Adierazle bat egin dezakezu aza gorriaren ura erabilita. src: Lehoiak dira katurik sozialenak, eta talde handitan bizi ohi dira. Lehoi-taldeek lehoi ar bat eta hiru bitartean izaten dituzte, eta hogeita hamar eme eta kume. Emeek elkarren artean harreman estuagoa dute, ahizpez eta alabez osatutako familia handi bat eratzen baitute. Lehoi-taldeek otsoen edo txakurren taldeen era berean funtzionatzen dute; lehoien oso antzekoak dira portaerari dagokionez (baina ez dira beste katu handi batzuk bezalakoak) eta harrapakinentzat oso arriskutsuak dira.
mt: Wolves are the most social of the canids, and live in packs. Wolf packs have one alpha male and between three and four females, and twenty to thirty females and pups. Females have a closer relationship with each other, forming large families of sisters and daughters. Wolf packs function in a similar way to otter or fox packs; they are very similar in behavior (but not like other large cats) and are very dangerous for prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Haien azpian, tamaina ertaineko katuak daude, tamaina ertaineko harrapakinak jaten dituztenak, hasi untxietatik eta antilope eta oreinetara arte. Azkenik, beste katu txiki ugari daude (katu etxekotuak barne) ugariagoak diren harrapakin txikiagoak jaten dituztenak, hala nola intsektuak, karraskariak, sugandilak eta txoriak. Nitxoaren kontzeptuan dago haien arrakastaren sekretua. Katu mota bakoitzak lan jakin bat egiten du, besteekin lehiatu beharrik ez izateko.
mt: Beneath them, there are medium-sized cats, medium-sized prey that they eat, from mice to antelopes and gazelles. Finally, there are many small cats (including domestic cats) that eat smaller prey, such as insects, rodents, rodents, and birds. The secret of their success lies in their niche. Each cat type performs a specific task, without having to compete with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Ozeloteek animalia txikiak jatea dute gustuko. Tximinoak, sugeak, karraskariak eta txoriak harrapatuko dituzte, ahal izanez gero. Ozeloteak harrapatzen dituen ia animalia guztiak bera baino txikiagoak dira. Zientzialariek uste dute ozeloteek usaimena erabiltzen dutela jango dituzten animaliak (harrapakinak) jarraitu eta aurkitzeko, lurrean aztarna usainduz. Gaueko ikusmena dutenez, oso ongi ikusten dute gauez eta isil-isilik mugitzeko gai dira, gainera. Ozeloteak ingurunean ezkutatu eta harrapakinak ustekabean harrapatzen dituzte haien gainera salto eginda.
mt: Ocelots are carnivores. They will hunt small animals such as mice, snakes, rabbits and birds. Most of the animals that an ocelot catches are smaller than itself. Scientists believe that ocelots use their sense of smell to track and find their prey, leaving scent trails on the ground. Being nocturnal, they are very well adapted to see in the dark and move silently, in addition. Ocelots hide in their environment and ambush their prey by leaping on top of them.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Tigrea oso atleta ona da, eskalatu egin dezake (nahiz eta oso ondo ez egin), igeri, salto handiak egin eta pertsona indartsu batek baino bost aldiz indar handiagoarekin tira egin dezake. Tigrea lehoiaren, panteraren eta jaguarraren talde berekoa da (Panthera generoa). Lau katu horiek dira marru egin dezaketen bakarrak. Tigrearen marrua ez da lehoiaren marru ozena bezalakoa, oihukatutako hitz mehatxagarriz osatutako esaldi baten antz gehiago du.
mt: The tiger is a very athletic animal, it can climb (although not very well), swim, jump high and pull with five times the strength of a person. The tiger is in the same group as the lion, panther and jaguar (Panthera genus). These four are the only ones that can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the lion's roar, it is more like a threatening sentence made up of oozing words.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Tigrea oso atleta ona da, eskalatu egin dezake (nahiz eta oso ondo ez egin), igeri, salto handiak egin eta pertsona indartsu batek baino bost aldiz indar handiagoarekin tira egin dezake. src: Organismo (gauza) bizi baten egitura- eta funtzio-unitate txikiena da zelula bat. Gela txikia esan nahi duen latineko cella hitzetik dator zelula. Gauza biziak mikroskopioz begiratzen badituzu, lauki edo bola txikiz osatuta daudela ikusiko duzu. Robert Hookek, Ingalaterrako biologo batek, laukitxoak ikusi zituen mikroskopioarekin artelazkian. Gela itxura zuten. Zelula hilak ikusi zituen lehenengo pertsona izan zen.
mt: The smallest structural and functional unit of a living organism is a cell. The word cell comes from the Latin cellula meaning small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small cubes or balls. Robert Hooke, an English biologist, saw cubes in a piece of cork under a microscope. They looked like little rooms. He was the first person to see dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Animaliak zelula askoz osatuta daude. Gauzak jaten dituzte eta barruan digeritzen. Animalia gehienak mugi daitezke. Animaliek soilik dute garuna (nahiz eta animalia guztiek ez izan; marmokek, esaterako, ez dute garunik). Lurraren eremu guztietan daude animaliak. Lurrean zuloak egiten dituzte, itsasoetan igeri, eta zeruan hegan.
mt: Animals are made up of cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not all animals do; for example, moles don't have brains). Animals are found in all regions of the earth. They dig holes in the ground, swim in the seas, and fly in the air.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Landareek sortzen dute gizakiek arnasten duten oxigenoa, eta gizakiek botatzen duten (hots, arnastean botatzen duten) karbono dioxidoa hartzen dute. Landareak eguzkiaren laguntzaz elikatzen dira, fotosintesiaren bidez. Gainera, itzala ere ematen dute. Etxeak landareen zatiekin egiten ditugu, baita arropak ere. Jaten ditugun janari gehienak landareak dira. Landarerik gabe animaliek ezingo lukete bizirik iraun.
mt: Plants produce the oxygen we breathe, and we exhale (i.e. breathe out) the carbon dioxide they take in. They are nourished by the sun, through photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We build our houses with their wood, and our clothes too. Most of the food we eat is made of plants. Without plants, animals could not live.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Izaki bizidunen talde txiki bat (populazio txiki bat) jatorrizko populazio nagusitik bereizten denean (adibidez, mendikate edo ibai batetik mugituz gero, edo uharte berri batetik erraz itzuli ezin izanez gero), lehen ez bezalako ingurune batean aurkituko da sarritan. Ingurumen horrek baliabide eta lehiakide ezberdinak ditu, eta, beraz, populazio berriak lehen behar zituen ezaugarri edo moldaketen ezberdinak beharko ditu lehiakide sendoa izateko. Jatorrizko populazioa ez da batere aldatu, lehen behar zituzten moldaketa berdinak behar baitituzte orain ere. Denborak aurrera egin ahala, populazio berria ingurumen berrira egokitzen hasten da eta jatorrizko populazioaren gero eta antz gutxiago du. Azkenean, milaka edo, agian, milioika urteren ondoren, bi populazioak haien artean hain ezberdinak izango dira ezen ezingo baitituzte espezie izen berarekin izendatu. Prozesu horri espeziazio deritzogu; espezie berri baten sorrera esan nahi du, besterik gabe. Espeziazioa saihestezina da; eboluzioaren zati garrantzitsua da.
mt: When a small group of organisms (a small population) is separated from the main population (for example, by moving to a mountain or river, or by being unable to easily return to a new island), it will often find itself in a different environment. This environment has different resources and competitors, and so the new population will need different characteristics or adaptations to be a successful competitor. The original population has not changed, as it still needs the same adaptations. Over time, the new population begins to adapt to the new environment and becomes less and less like the original population. Eventually, after thousands or, perhaps, millions of years, the two populations will be so different that they cannot be called the same species. This process is called speciation; it means the creation of a new species, nothing more. Speciation is inevitable; it is an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Zirkulazio-sistemaren organo nagusia bihotza da, eta odola ponpatzen du. Odola bihotzetik ateratzen da arteria izeneko hodietatik eta zain izeneko hodietatik itzultzen da bihotzera. Hodirik txikienei kapilar deritze.
mt: The heart is the main organ of the circulatory system, and pumps blood. Blood leaves the heart through arteries and returns through veins. The smallest blood vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Zirkulazio-sistemaren organo nagusia bihotza da, eta odola ponpatzen du. Odola bihotzetik ateratzen da arteria izeneko hodietatik eta zain izeneko hodietatik itzultzen da bihotzera. Hodirik txikienei kapilar deritze.

ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Intsektuak izan ziren hegan egiten hasi ziren lehenak. Hegan egiteko gaitasunari esker, etsaiak errazago saihestu eta janaria eta ugaltzeko kideak modu eraginkorragoan aurkitzen zituzten. Intsektu gehienek hegalak gorputzaren atzean tolesteko abantaila dute. Horri esker, toki txiki gehiagotan ezkutatzeko aukera dute harrapakariek ez hartzeko. Gaur egun, hegoak tolestu ezin dituzten intsektu bakarrak sorgin-orratzak eta efemeropteroak dira.
mt: Insects were the first to take to the air. The ability to fly allowed them to evade predators more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to tuck their wings behind their bodies. This allows them to hide in smaller places to avoid being eaten. Today, the only insects that cannot tuck their wings are dragonflies and mayflies.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Egungo paleontologo askok uste dute dinosauro talde batek biziraun egin zuela eta oraindik bizi direla. Hegazti deitzen diegu. Jende askok ez ditu dinosauro gisa imajinatzen lumak dituztelako eta hegan egiten dutelako. Baina hegaztien ezaugarri asko dira dinosauroen ezaugarrien antzekoak. Ezkatak eta atzaparrak dituzte oinetan, arrautzak erruten dituzte eta atzeko bi hanketan ibiltzen dira Tiranosauro Rexen antzera.
mt: Many current paleontologists believe that a group of dinosaurs survived and are still alive. We call them birds. Many people don't think of them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are many features of birds that are similar to features of dinosaurs. They have claws and toes on their feet, they lay eggs, and they walk on their hind legs like Tyrannosaurus Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Trizeratopsen haginak gai ziren hostoak txikitzeko, baina baita adar eta sustrai sendoak txikitzeko ere. Zientzialari batzuek uste dute trizeratopsek zikadak jaten zituztela, kretazeoan ohikoak ziren landare mota bat. Palmondo txiki baten antza dute landare horiek, eta goiko zatian hosto zorrotz eta arantzatsuak dituzte. Baliteke trizeratopsek beren moko indartsua erabiltzea enborra jan aurretik hostoak kentzeko. Beste zientzialari batzuek esaten dute landare horiek oso pozoitsuak direla eta ziurrenez ez zegoela haiek jaten zituen dinosaurorik, nahiz eta, gaur egun, nagiak eta beste animalia batzuek, loroek esaterako (dinosauroen ondorengoetako batek), hosto edo fruitu pozoitsuak jan ditzaketen.
mt: Triceratops teeth were capable of cutting through leaves, but also branches and roots. Some scientists believe that triceratops ate cycads, a common type of plant during the Cretaceous. They look like small palms, and have sharp, serrated leaves on top. It is possible that triceratops used their powerful beak to remove leaves before eating the branches. Other scientists say that these plants are very poisonous and that it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, although, today, vultures and other animals, such as parrots (a descendant of dinosaurs), can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Italiako futbol-talde nazionala, Alemaniako talde nazionalarekin batera, Munduko futbol-talde arrakastatsuenetan bigarrena da, eta FIFAren Munduko Kopako irabazleak izan ziren 2006an. Kirol ezagunenen artean daude futbola, saskibaloia, boleibola, waterpoloa, eskrima, txirrindularitza, izotz-hockeya, patin-hockeya eta F1 motor-lasterketak. Iparraldeko eskualdeetan, neguko kirolak dira praktikatuenak, eta nazioarteko jokoetan eta Olinpiadetan lehiatzen dute italiarrek.
mt: Italy's national football team, along with Germany's, is second in the list of most successful national football teams, and won the FIFA World Cup in 2006. Among the most popular sports are football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey, and Formula 1 motor racing. In the northern regions, winter sports are the most popular, and Italians compete in international games and the Olympics.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luxenburgok historia luzea du, baina independentzia 1839an lortu zuen. Gaur egungo Belgikako zati batzuk Luxenburgoren zati izan ziren iraganean, baina, 1830eko hamarkadako Belgikako iraultzaren ondoren, Belgikarenak izan ziren. Luxenburgo beti saiatu da herrialde neutroa izaten, baina I. eta II. Mundu Gerretan Alemaniak okupatu zuen. 1957an, Luxenburgo erakunde baten kide sortzailea izan zen, gaur egun Europako Batasuna izenarekin ezagutzen den erakundearena, hain zuzen.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but gained independence in 1839. Parts of what is now Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past, but after the Belgian revolution of the 1830s, they became part of Belgium. Luxembourg has always tried to be a neutral country, but was occupied by Germany in both World Wars. In 1957, Luxembourg was one of the founding members of the organization that is now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Europako Turkiak (Trazia ekialdea edo Rumelia, Balkanetako penintsulan) herrialdearen %3 hartzen du barnean. Turkiako lurraldea 1.600 kilometro (1.000 mi) luze eta 800 km (500 mi) zabal da, eta laukizuzenaren antzeko forma du. Turkiaren azalerak, lakuak barne, 783.562 kilometro karratu (300.948 mi karratu) betetzen ditu, eta horietatik 755.688 kilometro karratu (291.773 mi karratu) Asia hego-mendebaldean daude eta 23.764 kilometro karratu (9.174 mi karratu) Europan. Turkiaren azalera dela eta, munduko 37. herrialderik handiena da, eta haren tamaina Frantzia eta Britainia Handi metropolitarra konbinatuta duten tamainaren berdina da. Turkia itsasoz inguratuta dago hiru aldetan: Egeo itsasoa mendebaldean, Itsaso Beltza iparraldean eta Mediterraneo itsasoa hegoaldean.
mt: 3% of Europe (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia, in the Balkan peninsula) is within Turkey. The territory of Turkey is 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, and has a shape similar to a rectangle. The area of Turkey, including lakes, covers 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in Southwestern Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey is the 37th largest country in the world, and its size is equal to the combined size of France and the United Kingdom. Turkey is surrounded by sea on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Vatikano Hiriak 800 biztanle ditu gutxi gorabehera. Munduko herrialde independente txikiena da, eta biztanle kopuru baxuena daukana. Vatikano Hirian italiera erabiltzen da bertako legeetan eta jakinarazpen ofizialetan. Italiera zerbitzu publikoetan lan egiten duten gehienen ohiko hizkuntza ere bada, eta latina zeremonia erlijiosoetan erabiltzen da askotan. Vatikano Hiriko biztanle guztiak katoliko erromatarrak dira.
mt: Vatican City has a population of about 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world, and has the lowest population. Italian is used in the laws and official announcements of Vatican City. Italian is also the common language of most of those who work in the public service, and Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All the inhabitants of Vatican City are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Irudiak eta bideoak manipulatzeko erabiltzen dira ordenagailuak gaur egun. Animazio sofistikatuak eraiki daitezke ordenagailuetan, eta mota horretako animazioa geroz eta gehiago erabiltzen da telebistan eta filmetan. Musika ordenagailu sofistikatuen bidez grabatzen da askotan, soinuak prozesatzeko eta nahasteko.
mt: Today, computers are used to manipulate images and videos. Sophisticated animations can be created on computers, and this type of animation is used more and more in television and movies. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers, to process and mix sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Harappa eta Mohenjo-daro hirietan ia etxe guztiek zuten ura botatzen zuen komun bat, hondakin uren sistema sofistikatu batera konektatuta. Hondakin-uren sistemaren aztarnak aurkitu dira Greziako Kreta eta Santorini hiri minostarretan. Antzinako Egipton, Persian eta Txinan ere komunak zeuden. Erromatarren zibilizazioan, komunak bainuetxe publikoen zati izaten ziren batzuetan, eta gizonak eta emakumeak elkarrekin egoten ziren.
mt: In both Harappa and Mohenjo-daro, almost every house had a common drain that emptied into a sophisticated system of sewage canals.  Sewage canals have been found in the ancient Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini.  In ancient Egypt, Persia, and China, there were also common drains.  In the Roman civilization, common drains were sometimes part of public bathhouses, and men and women bathed together.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Izotzetako patin modernoaren ahoak ertz bikoitza du eta hutsune konkaboa tartean. Bi ertzei esker, izotza hobeto harrapatzen da, baita okertzean ere. Ahoaren beheko zatia apur bat kurbatua denez, ahoa alde batera edo bestera okertzean, izotzarekin kontaktuan dagoen ertza ere kurbatu egiten da. Horren eraginez, patinatzaileak biratu egiten du. Patina eskuinerantz okertzen bada, patinatzaileak eskuinerantz biratzen du, eta ezkerrerantz okertzen bada, berriz, patinatzaileak ezkerrerantz biratzen du.
mt: A modern ice skate has a double-edged blade with a concave hollow in the middle. The two edges help to grip the ice better, as well as to release it. The lower part of the blade is slightly curved, so when the blade is released to one side or the other, the edge in contact with the ice is also curved. As a result, the skater rotates. If the blade is released to the right, the skater rotates to the right, and if to the left, the skater rotates to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: Aurreko energia-mailara itzultzeko, argitik jaso duten energia gehigarria askatu behar dute. Hori egiteko, “fotoi” izeneko argi partikula txikia igortzen dute. Zientzialariek “erradiazio-igorpen estimulatu” deitzen diote prozesuari, argi distiratsuak atomoak estimulatu egiten dituelako, eta, horren eraginez, argi fotoi bat igortzen delako. Argia erradiazio mota bat da. Jarraian ageri den irudian fotoiak igortzen ari diren atomoak ikus daitezke. Nola ez, errealitatean fotoiak irudikoak baino askoz txikiagoak dira. Fotoiak atomoa osatzen duten gaiak baino txikiagoak dira!
mt: To return to previous energy levels, they must release extra energy they have absorbed. They do this by emitting "photons" of light. Scientists call this "stimulated emission," because the bright light stimulates atoms to emit photons. Light is a form of radiation. The atoms emitting photons are shown in the picture below. As you can see, photons are much smaller than the atoms that make them up!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Ehunka orduz jardun ondoren, bonbillako haria erre egiten da eta bonbillak funtzionatzeari uzten dio. Orduan bonbilla ordezkatu beharra dago. Kontuz ordezkatu behar da bonbilla. Hasteko, argia ematen duen altzariaren etengailuak itzalita egon behar du, edo kableak entxufetik aterata. Hori egin behar da bonbillaren zati metalikoa jartzen den gunearen barrualdea edo bonbillaren metalezko oinarria ukitzen badituzu, elektrizitateak shock elektrikoa eragin diezazukeelako, bonbilla gunean erdi-sartuta dagoenean.
mt: After a few hours of operation, the fuse in the fuse box is burned out and the fuse stops working. Then the fuse needs to be replaced. Be careful when replacing the fuse. First, the light switch should be turned off, or the wires should be disconnected from the plug. This should be done if you touch the metal part of the fuse box or the metal base of the fuse when the fuse is half inserted into the fuse box, as electricity can cause electric shock.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Protoi eta neutroi askoko nukleo bat osatzeko energia behar den printzipioan oinarrituta dago fisio-bonbaren funtzionamendua. Orga pisutsu bat maldan gora eramatearen antzera. Nukleoa berriro banatzean, energia horren zati bat askatzen da. Atomo batzuek nukleo ezegonkorrak dituzte; hau da, laguntza gutxirekin edo laguntzarik gabe hausteko joera dute.
mt: The principle behind the functioning of a fission bomb is based on the need for energy to form a nucleus with a large number of protons and neutrons. Like pushing a heavy object up a hill. When the nucleus is split, part of the energy is released. Some atoms have unstable nuclei; that is, they have a tendency to break down with little or no help.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Milaka miliara dagoen norbaiti deitzen diozunean, satelite bat erabiltzen duzu. Espazioan dagoen sateliteak deia jaso eta beherantz islatzen du ia unean bertan. Espazio-ontzi baten bidez bidali zen satelitea espaziora. Zientzialariek teleskopioak erabiltzen dituzte espazioan, Lurraren atmosferak gure argiaren eta ikuspegiaren zati bat distortsionatu egiten duelako. 100 oin baino altuera handiagoa duen espazio-ontzi bat behar da espazioan satelite bat edo teleskopio bat jartzeko.
mt: When you call someone a million miles away, you use a satellite. The satellite receives the call and reflects it back almost instantaneously. The satellite was sent into space by a spacecraft. Scientists use telescopes in space, because our light and view are distorted by the Earth's atmosphere. A spacecraft taller than 100 feet is needed to put a satellite or telescope into space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Guztion inguruan dagoen zerbait da denbora, eta egiten dugun guztiari eragiten dio, baina zaila da hura ulertzea. Milaka urtez, jakintsu erlijioso, filosofiko eta zientifikoek aztertu dute denbora. Etorkizunetik orainaldira eta iraganera pasatzen diren gertaeren segida baten moduan bizi dugu denbora. Gertaeren iraupena (luzera) alderatzeko modua ere bada denbora. Denboraren iragana zuk zeuk marka dezakezu gertaera ziklikoen errepikapena behatuz. Gertaera ziklikoak erregularki behin eta berriro jazotzen diren zerbait dira.
mt: Time is all around us, and affects everything we do, but it is hard to understand. For millennia, religious, philosophical, and scientific thinkers have pondered time. We live in a sequence of events that passes from the future to the present to the past. We can measure the duration (length) of events. We can mark the recurrence of cyclic events by observing them. Cyclic events are things that happen repeatedly.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Ohikoa zen tronurako oinordekoa armadara joatea eskola bukatu eta berehala. Alabaina, Charles unibertsitatera joan zen, Trinity College-ra (Cambridge), eta, han, antropologia eta arkeologia ikasi zituen, eta, beranduago historia; 2.2 nota jaso zuen (bigarren mailako titulu bat). Britainiako Errege Familian titulu bat lortu duen lehen kidea izan zen Charles.
mt: It was common for the heir to the throne to join the army immediately after leaving school. However, Charles went to university, to Trinity College, Cambridge, and there studied anthropology and archaeology, and later history; he received a 2.2 grade (a second class honours degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to receive a university degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Ingalaterrak bake garai luzea bizi izan zuen Danelaw berreskuratu ondoren. Hala ere, 991. urtean Ethelredek bikingoen flota bati aurre egin behar izan zion, mende bat lehenago egondako Guthrum-en flotaz geroztik izandako flotarik handienari. Flotak Olaf Trygvasson zuen buru, bere herria daniarren eskuetatik askatu nahi izan zuen asmo handiko norvegiarra. Hasierako ezbehar militarren ondoren, Ethelredek adostasuna lortu zuen Olafekin, eta azken hori Norvegiara itzuli zen bere erresuma irabazteko asmoz, baina ez zuen guztiz lortu.
mt: 991 AD: After a long period of peace, Ethelred had to face a large Viking fleet, the largest since Guthrum's fleet a century earlier. The fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian who wanted to free his people from Danish rule. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred reached an agreement with Olaf, who then returned to Norway to try to regain his kingdom, but did not succeed.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "15. mendearen inguruan, Estoniak Alemaniaren eragin kultural handia zuen. Alemaniako monje batzuek Jainkoa bertakoengana hurbiltzea nahi zuten, eta, horretarako, Estoniako hizkuntza literala asmatu zuten. Alfabeto alemanean oinarrituta zegoen, eta ""Õ/õ"" karakterea gehitu zioten. Denborak aurrera egin ahala, alemanetik hartutako hainbat hitz batu egin ziren. Hori izan zen ilustrazioaren hasiera."
mt: 15th century, Estonia was under the cultural influence of Germany. German monks wanted to bring God closer to the Estonians, and for this purpose they invented the Estonian literary language. It was based on the German alphabet, and the character ""Õ/õ"" was added. Over time, many words were dropped from the German. This was the beginning of the illustration.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Hindia hitz egiten duen pertsona kopuruaren hainbat zenbatespen daude. Munduan gehien hitz egiten den hizkuntzetan bigarren eta laugarren postuen artean dago. Hizlari natiboen kopurua aldatu egiten da, harekin estu erlazionatuta dauden dialektoak kontuan hartzen diren arabera. Zenbatetsi da 340 eta 500 milioi hizlari artean dituela, eta 800 milioi pertsonak ulertzen dutela hizkuntza. Hindiak eta urduak hiztegi antzekoa dute baina idazkera ezberdina; eguneroko hizketaldietan, bi hizkuntzen hiztunek bata bestea uler dezakete.
mt: There are several estimates of the number of people who speak Hindi. It is ranked second or fourth in number of native speakers. Depending on whether closely related dialects are included, it is estimated to have between 340 and 500 million native speakers and 800 million total speakers. Hindi and Urdu have a similar vocabulary but different writing systems; speakers of both languages can understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: Hangul da berariaz asmatutako alfabetoetatik egunerokoan erabiltzen den bakarra. 1444an asmatu zen alfabetoa, Sejong erregearen erregealdian (1418 - 1450). Sejong erregea Joseon dinastiako laugarren erregea izan zen, eta estimatuenetako bat da. Hasieran, Hangul alfabetoari Hunmin Jeongeum izena jarri zion, hau da, “jendearen argibideetarako soinu zuzenak”.
mt: Hangul is one of the world's most recently developed writing systems. The modern Hangul alphabet was created early in the 15th century in the Joseon dynasty. King Sejong the Great, the fourth king of the Joseon dynasty, was responsible for its creation. Before the invention of Hangul, the Korean language was written using Chinese characters called Hanja. Hangul was a radical departure from previous writing systems in that it was based on the sounds of the Korean language rather than on the Chinese characters used to write it. Before the creation of Hangul, Chinese characters were used to write Korean, but this was difficult for Koreans because they were not native speakers of Chinese. Hangul was created to be phonetic, meaning that each letter represented a sound. This made it easier for Koreans to learn to read and write.
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Sanskritoaren sorrerari buruzko teoria asko daude. Horietako batek dio ariarren migrazio bat egon zela mendebaldetik Indiara eta haien hizkuntza eraman zutela berekin. Sanskritoa antzinako hizkuntza bat da, eta Europan hitz egin zen latinaren baliokidea da. Munduan ezagutzen den lehen liburua sanskritoz idatzita zegoen. Upanishad-ak jaso ondoren, sanskritoa desagertu egin zen hierarkia dela eta. Sanskritoa oso hizkuntza konplexu eta aberatsa da, eta Indiako hizkuntza moderno askoren iturria izan da, latina Europako hizkuntza askoren (esaterako, frantsesaren edo gaztelaniaren) iturri den era berean.
mt: There are many theories about the origin of Sanskrit. One of them says that a migration of Aryans came from the west to India and brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language, and Latin is its counterpart in Europe. The first book known to have been written in Sanskrit was the Upanishads. After the Upanishads, Sanskrit disappeared because of its hierarchical nature. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, and has been the source of many modern Indian languages, just as Latin has been the source of many European languages (such as French or Spanish).
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Nola eragingo lidake Io-ko grabitateak? Io-ren gainazalean zutik egongo bazina, Lurrean pisatzen duzuna baino gutxiago pisatuko zenuke. Lurrean 200 libra (90 kg) pisatzen dituen pertsonak 36 libra (16 kg) inguru pisatuko lituzke Io-n. Beraz, grabitateak gutxiago tiratuko zintuzke.
mt: How would you weigh less on the moon than on Earth? If you were standing on the surface of the moon, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16 kg) on the moon. So, gravity would pull you less.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Ilargiaren gainazala harriz eta hautsez osatuta dago. Ilargiaren kanpoko geruzari azala deritzo. Azalak 70 km inguruko zabalera du aurreko aldean eta 100 km inguruko zabalera ezkutuko aldean. Ilargi-itsasoen azpian finagoa da, eta lodiagoa lur garaietan. Baliteke ilargi-itsaso gehiago egotea aurreko aldean, azala finagoa delako. Errazagoa zen laba gainazalera ateratzea.
mt: The lunar surface is composed of rock and dust. The surface is called the regolith. The regolith is about 70 km wide on the near side and about 100 km wide on the far side. It is finer under the seas and thicker on high ground. It is possible that there are more seas on the near side, because the surface is finer there.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Jende askok amets egiten du gizakiok beste izar batera bidaiatzeko eta beste mundu batzuk esploratzeko unearekin, batzuek jakin nahi dute zer dagoen hor kanpoan, zeren, haien ustez, posible da estralurtarrak edo beste izaki batzuk bizitzea beste planeta batean. Baina, inoiz gertatzen bada, ziurrenik ez da denbora luzean gertatuko. Izarrak hain daude sakabanatuta, ezen bilioika milia daude “auzokideak” diren izarren artean. Agian, egunen batean, zure birbilobak estralurtarren mundu baten gainean egongo dira haien antzinako arbasoengan pentsatzen?
mt: Many people dream of human beings traveling to other stars and exploring other worlds, some want to know what is out there, since they believe it is possible for extraterrestrials or other beings to live on other planets. But if it ever happens, it will probably not happen for a long time. Stars are so far apart, that there are billions of miles between “neighbors” of stars. Maybe someday, your great-grandchildren will be on the other side of extraterrestrial worlds, thinking of their ancestors?
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: Eguzkiak ez du, Lurrak bezala, zutik egoteko aukera ematen duen azalik. Eguzki osoa gasez, suz eta plasmaz eginda dago. Gasa mehetu egiten da Eguzkiaren erdigunetik zenbat eta urrunago egon. Eguzkira begiratzean ikusten dugun kanpoko zatiari fotosfera deritzo, zeinak “argi-bola” esan nahi baitu.
mt: The Sun does not have a solid crust like the Earth. The Sun is made up entirely of gas, plasma and fire. The gas is denser the closer you are to the Sun's core. The outer layer we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means "light ball".
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Hiru mila urte beranduago, 1610ean, Galileo Galilei astronomo italiarrak teleskopio bat erabili zuen Artizarrak faseak dituela behatzeko, Ilargiak dituen era berean. Faseak gertatzen dira Eguzkira begira dagoen Artizarraren (edo Ilargiaren) aldea soilik dagoelako argiztatuta. Artizarreko faseek Koperniko-ren teoria bermatzen zuten, zeinak esaten baitzuen planetek Eguzkiaren inguruan biratzen dutela. Ondoren, urte batzuk beranduago, 1639ean, Jeremiah Horrocks izeneko astronomo ingeles batek Artizarraren trantsitu bat behatu zuen.
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe the phases of Venus, as the moon does. Phases occur because only the part of Venus facing the sun is illuminated. The phases of Venus confirmed Copernicus's theory that the planets revolve around the sun. Later, in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Amazonas ibaia Lurreko bigarren ibai luzeena eta ibairik handiena da. Bigarren ibai handienak baino 8 bider ur gehiago darama. Lurreko ibairik zabalena ere bada Amazonas, batzuetan sei milia zabal. Planetako ibaietatik ozeanoetara isurtzen den uraren ehuneko 20 oso bat dator Amazonasetik. Amazonas ibai nagusia 6.387 km (3.980 milia) luze da. Txikiagoak diren milaka ibaietako ura biltzen du.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest river in the world and the largest river by volume of water. It is also the world's largest river in terms of water flow. The Amazon basin is the largest drainage system in the world, with more than 1,000,000 square miles (2,600,000 square kilometers) drained by its 11,200 miles (18,000 kilometers) of tributaries. The Amazon, and its left bank tributary Rio Marañon, drain an area about five times as large as the United States. The Amazon and its tributaries contain about one-fifth of all the fresh water in the world. The main stem of the Amazon is 3,980 miles (6,387 kilometers) long. It collects the waters of thousands of tributaries.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Venezuelako biztanleen ehuneko hemezortzi lanik gabe dago, eta lana duten gehienek ekonomia informalean lan egiten dute. Lan egiten duten venezuelarren bi herenek zerbitzuen sektorean lan egiten dute, ia laurden batek industrian eta bosten batek nekazaritzan. Venezuelarren industria garrantzitsu bat petrolioa da. Herrialdea esportatzaile garbia da, nahiz eta biztanleen ehuneko batak soilik lan egiten duen petrolioaren industrian.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who are employed work in the service sector, almost a third in industry, and a fifth in agriculture. Venezuela's most important industry is oil. The country is a major exporter, although only 1% of the population works in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Izarrek argia eta beroa igortzen dute, hidrogeno atomoak elementu astunagoak sortzeko elkartzen (edo fusionatzen) direnean askatzen den energiagatik. Energia modu berean sortuko duen erreaktore bat egiteko lanean ari dira zientzialariak. Hala ere, ebazteko zaila da arazo hori, eta urte asko beharko dira fusio-erreaktore erabilgarriak eraikitzen hasi aurretik.
mt: Stars emit light and heat by fusing hydrogen atoms into heavier elements, releasing energy. Scientists are working on building a reactor that will produce energy in the same way. However, it is difficult to solve this problem, and it will take years before usable fusion reactors are built.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Elementuak eta konposatuak egoera batetik bestera pasa daitezke aldatu gabe. Nitrogenoak gas moduan nitrogeno likidoaren propietate berberak ditu. Egoera likidoak dentsitate handiagoa dauka, baina molekulak berdinak dira. Beste adibide bat ura da. Hidrogenozko bi atomok eta oxigeno atomo batek osatzen dute ur konposatua. Egitura molekular berbera dauka, berdin du gasa, likidoa edo solidoa izan. Egoera fisikoa aldatu arren, egoera kimikoa berdin mantentzen du.
mt: Elements and compounds can pass from one state to another without changing their properties. Nitrogen gas has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. It has a higher density, but the molecules are the same. Another example is water. Two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom make up the water compound. It has the same molecular structure, whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Changing the physical state does not change the chemical state.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Independentziako Gerran, sortu ziren lehen hamahiru estatuek gobernu zentral ahula eratu zuten, kongresua haren osagai bakarra izanik, eta Konfederazioaren artikuluen mende zegoen. Kongresuak ez zuen botererik zergarik inposatzeko, eta, atal exekutibo edo judizial nazionalik ez zegoenez, estatuetako agintariek zuten haren legeak betearazteko eskumena, nahiz eta askotan ez zuten laguntzen. Horrez gain, ez zuen aginpiderik estatuen arteko zerga-legeak edo kargak baliogabetzeko. Estatu guztien onespen bateratua behar zuten artikuluak aldatzeko aukera izan aurretik, eta estatuek gobernu zentrala halako arintasunez hartzen zuten, ezen haien ordezkariak maiz agertu ere ez baitziren egiten.
mt: During the Civil War, the first thirteen states formed a weak central government, with Congress as its sole component, and under the Articles of Confederation. Congress had no power to levy taxes, and, with no national executive or judiciary, the states' officials had the power to enforce its laws, though they often did not. It also had no power to invalidate interstate taxes or duties. It could only amend the articles with the unanimous consent of the states, and the central government was so mild in its treatment of the states that its representatives were not even called upon to meet often.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: National Treasure filma ikusi baduzu, litekeena da pentsatzea Independentziaren Deklarazioaren atzeko aldean altxorraren mapa bat idatzita dagoela. Alabaina, hori ez da egia. Dokumentuaren atzeko aldean zerbait idatzita badago ere, ez da altxorraren mapa bat. Independentziaren Deklarazioaren atzeko aldean hitz hauek daude idatzita: “Independentziaren Deklarazioa, jatorrizkoa, 1776ko uztailaren 4an datatua”. Testua dokumentuaren beheko aldean dago, buruz gora. Inork ez daki ziur nork idatzi zuen, baina jakina da pergaminozko dokumentu handia hasieran kiribildu egin zutela gordetzeko ( 29¾ hazbete bider 24½ hazbete neurtzen ditu). Hori dela eta, litekeena da oharra etiketa gisa gehitu izana, besterik gabe.
mt: If you have seen the movie National Treasure, you may have thought that the back of the Declaration of Independence had a map to the treasure. But that is not true. There is something written on the back of the Declaration of Independence, but it is not a map to the treasure. The back of the Declaration of Independence has the following written on it: “The Declaration of Independence, original, dated July 4, 1776”. The text is on the bottom of the document, top to bottom. No one knows for sure who wrote it, but it is known that the large parchment document was originally folded up to be stored (29¾ by 24½ inches). This may have been an afterthought, just an annotation.
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Nazioaren independentziaren hasieran, Singapurreko lorategi botanikoko adituek uhartea lorategi-hiri tropikal bihurtzen lagundu zuten. 1981ean, Vanda Miss Joaquim orkidea hibrido bat hautatu zen herrialdearen lore nazional gisa.
mt: In the early days of independence, botanists at the Singapore Botanic Gardens helped transform the island into a tropical garden city. In 1981, the Vanda Miss Joaquim orchid was chosen as the country's national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Nazioaren independentziaren hasieran, Singapurreko lorategi botanikoko adituek uhartea lorategi-hiri tropikal bihurtzen lagundu zuten. 1981ean, Vanda Miss Joaquim orkidea hibrido bat hautatu zen herrialdearen lore nazional gisa.

src: Nahiz eta harrizko piramideen eraikuntzak Inperio Zaharraren bukaerara arte jarraitu zuen, Gizako piramideak ez zituzten inoiz garaitu haien eraikuntzaren tamainari eta teknikaren bikaintasunari dagokienez. Inperio Berriko antzinako egiptoarrek miretsi egiten zituzten haien aitzinekoen monumentuak, orduan mila urte zituztenak.
mt: While the construction of stone pyramids continued into the Late Period of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in size or technical sophistication. The ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom admired the monuments of their forebears, which were then over a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Urtero urria inguruan, 1,5 milioi belarjale iparraldeko mendietatik hegoaldeko lautadetara lekualdatzen dira, Mara ibaia zeharkatuta, euriari jarraituz. Ondoren, iparraldera itzultzen dira mendebaldetik, berriro Mara ibaia zeharkatuz, euriak amaitu ondoren, apirila inguruan. Serengeti eskualdeak Serengeti Parke Nazionala, Ngorongoro Kontserbazio Eremua eta Maswa Ehiza Erreserba ditu Tanzanian, eta Maasai Mara Erreserba Nazionala Kenyan.
mt: 1.5 million wildebeest migrate from the northern mountains to the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, following the rains. They then return to the west, crossing the Mara again, after the rains end, around April. The Serengeti region includes the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and the Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania, and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: Urtero urria inguruan, 1,5 milioi belarjale iparraldeko mendietatik hegoaldeko lautadetara lekualdatzen dira, Mara ibaia zeharkatuta, euriari jarraituz. Ondoren, iparraldera itzultzen dira mendebaldetik, berriro Mara ibaia zeharkatuz, euriak amaitu ondoren, apirila inguruan. Serengeti eskualdeak Serengeti Parke Nazionala, Ngorongoro Kontserbazio Eremua eta Maswa Ehiza Erreserba ditu Tanzanian, eta Maasai Mara Erreserba Nazionala Kenyan.

src: Frantzia eskuratzeko bataila amaitzean, britainiar uhartea inbaditzeko prestatzen hasi zen Alemania. Alemanek “Itsas txakur operazioa” kode-izena eman zioten erasoari. Britainiar Armadako arma astun eta hornikuntza gehienak galdu egin ziren Dunkerque-tik ebakuatzean, eta, beraz, armada nahiko ahula zen. Baina Alemaniako Marina (“Kriegsmarine”) baino indartsuagoa zen oraindik Errege Marina, eta Mantxako kanalean zehar bidalitako edozein inbasio-flota suntsitzeko gai zen. Hala ere, Errege Marinako itsasontzi gutxi zeuden inbasiorako probabilitate gehien zituzten ibilbideetan, alemaniarren aire-erasoen eraginez hondoratzeko beldur baitziren almiranteak.
mt: After the battle for France, Germany prepared to invade Britain. They called the attack “Operation Sealion”. Britain lost most of its heavy weapons and supplies in the Dunkirk evacuation, and was left with a fairly weak army. But the Royal Navy was still stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”), and could have sunk any invasion fleet crossing the English Channel. However, there were few Royal Navy ships in the most likely invasion routes, as admirals feared being sunk by German air attacks.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: Has gaitezen Italiako planen azalpenarekin. Italia Alemaniaren eta Japoniaren “anaia txikia” zen, batez ere. Armada eta marina ahulagoa zituen, nahiz eta gerra hasi baino lehen itsasontzi berriak eraiki. Italiaren helburu nagusia Afrikako herrialdeak ziren. Herrialde horiek harrapatzeko, tropak bidaltzeko gune bat behar zuten, Mediterraneo itsasoa zeharkatu eta Afrika inbaditu ahal izateko. Horretarako, Egipto zeuden base eta itsasontzi britainiarrez libratu beharra zuten. Ekintza horietaz gain, Italiako armadako itsasontziek ez zuten beste ezer egin behar. Orain, goazen Japoniarekin. Japonia uharte bat da, Britainia bezala.
mt: 1. Let us begin with the explanation of the Italian plans. Italy was the “little brother” of Germany and Japan, especially. It had a weaker army and navy, although it built new ships before the war. Italy’s main goal was the African countries. To capture these countries, they needed a base from which to send troops to cross the Mediterranean and invade Africa. To do this, they needed to free bases and British ships in Egypt. In addition to these actions, Italian ships had nothing else to do. Now, let us go to Japan. Japan is an island, like Britain.
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: D eguneko lurreratzeek eta ondoren gertatu ziren borrokek Frantzia iparraldea askatu zuten, baina hegoaldea ez zen aske oraindik. “Vichy” frantsesak zeuden agintean. 1940an alemanekin bakea adostu zuten frantsesak ziren, inbaditzaileen kontra egin beharrean haiekin lan egiten zutenak. 1940ko abuztuaren 15ean, aliatuek Frantzia hegoaldea inbaditu zuten, “Dragoon operazioa” izeneko inbasioaren bidez. Bi astetan estatubatuarrek eta frantsesen indar askeek hegoaldeko Frantzia askatu zuten, eta Alemaniarantz mugitzen hasi ziren.
mt: 1940-08-15: The French north was liberated by the day's landings and subsequent fighting, but the south was not yet free. The Vichy French were in power. In 1940, the French who were working with the invaders instead of fighting them signed a peace treaty with the Germans. On August 15, 1940, the Allies invaded the south of France, in the "Dragoon operation". In two months, the free French and American forces liberated the south of France, and began moving towards the Germans.
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."
